dauphin-island-al-dauphin-island-campgro.editorialSummary: Roomy tent & RV sites on a forested property with a modern bathhouse, playground & beach access.

reviewSummary.text: We have always had a wonderful experience at Dauphin Island campground. The office staff is always friendly and helpful. We love the easy access to the beach, the fort, the aquarium, and BGH Cafe. The laundry area, bathrooms, and showers are very clean and the grounds are well maintained. Can't wait to return.

It appears this is a long term stay mostly. The RV's around us were growing moss on them they had been there so long. The camp sites need raked, tree branches and other plant debris all over the ground. One of the other residents kept coming and going in his diesel truck all night and again at 4:00 am. We felt very uncomfortable and not safe staying there.

photos.attribution: Katie Ferrari Backa (Fish Like A Kat)

gulf-shores-al-doc-s-rv-park.editorialSummary: RV park with 62 sites & 13 park model homes, plus a clubhouse, swimming pool & volleyball court.

reviewSummary.text: A great little RV park with all the standard amenities, full hookups, pool, laundry, bath house. The management here is great and Gulf Shores is a great destination. So much to see and do!

gulf-shores-al-gulf-state-park.editorialSummary: Serene park with beaches, trails & pier fishing plus tennis, golf & a zip line above the dunes.

reviewSummary.text:
We finally made it to Gulf State Park for our anniversary trip! It's a place we've wanted to visit for years, especially since getting our e-bikes. After a few tries of finding a spot, we were so excited to book our stay. üòÅ

On our anniversary, we drove the scenic coast in our Jeep, stopping along the way to enjoy appetizers from Gulf Shores to Destin and back.  We ended the night watching the sunset at the beach. It was a perfect way to celebrate. ü•Çüíñ

In the remaining two days, we biked over 85 miles, exploring all the park's trails and even riding the Fort Morgan Road trail outside the park. üö≤

I can confidently say this is the best state park we've ever camped at‚Äîthey truly have thought of everything. We're already planning our next trip and can't recommend it enough! üèïÔ∏è
#lanclosadventures

gulf-shores-al-island-retreat-rv-park.editorialSummary: Cozy RV campground with a pool, laundry & shower facilities, plus a playground, a clubhouse & Wi-Fi.

reviewSummary.text:
We chose to Air B&B a full size camper to be able to stay with our children & grand children who were staying here with there own camper. The camper was fully furnished with everything you could need including extra beach towels. We had a great experience & stay at Island Retreat RV park, it‚Äôs very affordable & It‚Äôs in an Excellent location about 1.5-2 miles from the main drag & beaches. The staff is super friendly as are all the amenities. It‚Äôs very clean & organized!
We highly recommend this RV Park.
Sincerely
Amanda P & Mike S

orange-beach-al-sun-outdoors-orange-beac.editorialSummary: Tranquil RV resort offering outdoor swimming pools, BBQ grills, a hot tub & wooded nature trails.

reviewSummary.text:
Sun Outdoors Orange Beach is part of a chain of master planned resorts with premium amenities for short term or extended, stays for families and snowbirds.
The on-site restaurant had a nice selection and the food was well prepared.
Two family pools, one adult pool and a splash pad for the children.
The team here is friendly, courteous, cheerful, and willing to help.
Unique to campgrounds, sun outdoor outdoors orange Beach offers a dog wash station.
Some sites have a dog pen for you to keep your furry friend in check.
The bath houses have individual stalls for your privacy and protection. Clean and new fixtures.
50 and 30 amp service is clean and consistent. The water pressure is appropriate.
The lake is loaded with fish.

The one thing you may experience here would be that there does not seem to be a sense of community. Whenever you have a large resort like this, there is a lot of concrete.  Campers check in and out constantly. The sites next to us changed campers 2x in the 6 days we were there.

While there are plenty of family friendly amenities, there is less of a family atmosphere feeling here. It feels more corporate run as an upscale RV resort.
And with that comes a lot of rules. Most of the rules there are to keep the campground, clean, orderly, and free of one star campers.  I agree with all of them! Take your own trash to the dumpster!!

The one rule that I find comical is the 5 1/2 mph speed limit. In my six days there I saw not one driver obey the limit. You‚Äôll get some ugly looks from the folks behind you when you drive 5 1/2 mph.  So be it. I‚Äôm a rule follower.
We like this location better than the Sun Outdoors in Islamorada as the sites here are not on top of each other like they are in the keys.
We love the place and will be back again and again.
Highly recommended

little-rock-ar-downtown-riverside-rv-par.editorialSummary: Unassuming riverside RV park featuring 50-amp hookups, plus boat-ramp access & free Wi-Fi.

reviewSummary.text:
We had an fantastic two-week stay at Downtown Riverside RV, and honestly, it was an all-around great experience. The location is perfect ‚Äî right in the heart of town, making it super easy to explore the area and enjoy everything it has to offer. The facilities are top-notch; the bathrooms and laundry area were always spotless, modern, and well-maintained, which made our stay even more comfortable. It‚Äôs nice to find a place that keeps everything clean and up to date, especially during such a long visit.

The staff in the office were some of the friendliest and most helpful people we‚Äôve encountered at a campground. They greeted us with big smiles and went out of their way to answer questions and make sure we had everything we needed. And if you‚Äôre a dog owner, you‚Äôre in luck ‚Äî they really love dogs here! It‚Äôs clear they‚Äôre animal lovers, and they made us feel very welcome along with our furry friend.

The security was also great ‚Äî I honestly felt safe during our entire stay. While the area feels like it‚Äôs not in the absolute nicest part of town, I never had any concerns, thanks to the good security and the friendly atmosphere. Plus, it was easy to get to anywhere in the Little Rock area from here, which made our adventures simple and convenient.

Overall, the whole experience exceeded our expectations. The location, cleanliness, friendly staff, and dog-friendly attitude made our stay memorable and stress-free. If you‚Äôre looking for a comfortable, friendly, and convenient place to stay in Riverside, I highly recommend Downtown Riverside RV. We will definitely be back!

morrilton-ar-petit-jean-state-park.editorialSummary: Destination featuring a historic lodge with a pool, plus hiking, boating & dramatic natural scenery.

reviewSummary.text: We had a group of 8 camping in 4 RV's.  This park has beautiful views. The waterfall is very small this time of year, but in the spring it is large. Many sites to see with a short walk. The Rockefeller's have a place & airport on the mountain on the East side.  Call colors were perfect this time of year. We spent the day exploring

We stayed at this campground twice this month....this can be a very nice park, alot a sites are big and somewhat private...others close together
One thing I will say, they need to take better care of the grounds....see attached pictures.
Make sure you have extra long hoses since some sites have water on the opposite side of the site. Some sites have asphalt pads that have buckled.
With a little maintenance this could be a very very nice campground. We stayed there for overnight stops because very convenient to highway....but found it trashy.

We went mid -November. Its a great location to stay right in the park. We had full hook-ups and it was quiet. The elk walked right through the campground which was fun to see. However, there are no amenities in the park for kids like playgrounds or anything. The showers were closed.
They have a free shuttle.bus that comes every 15 minutes to the front of the park and it takes you to the Village downtown, the visitor center and many more stops in The Grand Canyon. It makes it easy to get around and not worry about parking.

tucson-az-crazy-horse-rv-park.editorialSummary: Family RV campsite offering a pool & a recreation hall with activities like billiards, bingo & more.

reviewSummary.text: Most excellent place to get off the road for the night.   Convenient to the interstate without any of the noise. No fuss, no hassle.   Thanks for a very restful night!!

tucson-az-sentinel-peak-rv-park.editorialSummary: Convenient RV park with a pool, clubhouse, laundromat & restrooms served by a shuttle & light rail.

reviewSummary.text: We had a great experience during our one-night stay, enjoying the cleanliness and peacefulness of the space. After a disappointing start at Sunshine Mile RV Park, we were thrilled to find this alternative RV site and make the most of our night.

anaheim-ca-canyon-rv-park.editorialSummary: Full-hookup RV sites plus log cabins in parklike surrounds, with a pool, playground & secluded feel.

reviewSummary.text:
The place is absolutely beautiful. It's definitely secure with needing to have a pass and having someone open the gate.

Of course it is noisy being near the highway. Next time we will look for a spot that is further away from the highway.

The second day that we were there we brought some friends back with us because we were having a problem with our pop-up tent and we wanted their help.

I did not know the protocol for bringing someone in with us since they only allow one car through the gate at a time which makes sense.

However when I went to the office the person I spoke to was a little snippy and nasty saying that all I needed to do was wave my pass out the window. I explained that yes I knew that however I needed to also let my friends in to help me with our pop-up trailer.

There was any barrage of questions about if they were going to stay overnight were they staying in my trailer etc.

I had clearly explained that they came by simply to look at the trailer and give us some advice and I thought the snippy questions were a little much.

big-bear-city-ca-serrano-campground.editorialSummary: Campground in San Bernardino National Forest featuring a comfort station, RV hookups & fire rings.

reviewSummary.text: Beautiful campground. Spacious and very clean, great toilets and hot showers. There is a gorgeous bike path that leads to the lake, campground was very busy  but everyone was quiet and respectful. I gave it 4 stars because we saw mice running around our tent few times and it‚Äôs the only thing that might stop me from returning unfortunately:(

castro-valley-ca-anthony-chabot-regional.editorialSummary: Huge, 3,304-acre park offering hiking & biking trails, plus a campground & an equestrian center.

reviewSummary.text:
I have ran Lake Chabot over 50 times, hike almost every trail ridden my bike and rented pontoon boats with the family for a daily excursion. This was our first experience camping here and it was a blast. Typically I travel hundreds of miles to get away from daily city life. If I only knew it was in my backyard all this time!

This was my son's first camp out and I couldn't ask for a better place.

death-valley-ca-furnace-creek-campground.editorialSummary: Desert national park campground with 136 sites & 18 hook-ups, washrooms, water supply & fire pits.

reviewSummary.text: If you‚Äôve ever wanted to feel like you‚Äôve landed on another planet, Furnace Creek is the place. I stayed here during my RV journey and was blown away by the surreal beauty ‚Äî golden mountains, endless salt flats, and night skies so clear you feel wrapped in starlight. The campground is quiet, clean, and incredibly well-maintained considering the extreme environment. Sites are level, easy to access, and perfect for photography at sunrise and sunset. Rangers were welcoming and full of great tips for exploring nearby Badwater Basin and Zabriskie Point. Bella and I loved our stay here. If you want an unforgettable national park experience, this is the one.

half-moon-bay-ca-pelican-point-rv-park.editorialSummary: RV park featuring full hooups, free Wi-Fi, laundry & a store, plus ocean & golf course views.

reviewSummary.text:
A little gem hidden in one of the most beautiful coastlines in California. The view from our campsite down to the ocean was spectacular. We saw whales and pelicans and owls and other types of birds.

The location of this park is spectacular - the beach is a three minute walk down the hill and we were particularly impressed that we  could take your dogs and enjoy this little private beach all to our ourselves most of the time - it was so quiet!!

Another great feature of this location is the coastal trail - a cliff top walk that takes you through the Carlton Ritz golf course and along the top of the cliffs with the most beautiful view of this rugged coastline.

Definitely coming back here next time we are in half Moon Bay!!

half-moon-bay-ca-pillar-point-rv-park.editorialSummary: Basic non-reservable RV park with 49 hookups next to the oceanfront, beach & a 6-mi. trail.

reviewSummary.text: We returned her for the nostalgia of having stayed her 7 years ago. Been upgraded since then. Freshly paved and lined.  It‚Äôs very basic. No facilities or office.  Nice camp host who was super helpful.  It is very loud as it sits right on the highway, but the attraction is the water and its proximity to some great walking trails and restaurants.  It is costly. $95 regular, $140 for an ocean view. Good wifi. Nice level lots with room to spread your chairs.

hesperia-ca-silverwood-lake-state-recrea.editorialSummary: Park sitting along the Pacific Crest Trail is home to Silverwood Lake reservoir & hiking trails.

reviewSummary.text: Weekdays, Silverwood Lake Recreational Area is Dr. Jeckle...but on the weekends it turns into Mr. Hyde. In other words, enjoy it through the week. It's a beautiful place with lots of wildlife (had a little bobcat chasing quail around my campsite) very quiet and peaceful...but come friday night you can expect crowds and noise! Bathrooms were clean through the week...but weekend crowds with kids leave their mark, so to speak. Showers were clean, but no hot water. Bring your quarters. Nice paved bike trail...boat ramp and fishing.

playa-del-rey-ca-dockweiler-beach-rv-par.editorialSummary: Simple oceanfront RV campground offering showers & laundry facilities, plus picnic tables & hookups.

reviewSummary.text:
üå¥üöê **Beachfront Bliss at Dockweiler RV Park!** üêæüåä

Just wrapped up a relaxing 5 day stay at **Dockweiler RV Park** in Playa Del Rey‚Äîand wow, what a gem! If you're looking for an RV spot that puts you *right on the beach*, this is it. The views of the Pacific are unbeatable, and the sound of the waves makes for the perfect backdrop to unwind.

üê∂ **Dog-friendly? Absolutely!** Our pups had a blast running along the clean, wide beach. It‚Äôs one of the few places where both humans and dogs can enjoy the ocean breeze together.

üì∂ **AT&T service was flawless**‚Äîfull bars the entire time, which made remote work and streaming a breeze.

üöø **Restrooms and showers could use a little TLC**, but they‚Äôre functional. If you‚Äôve got your own setup in your RV, you‚Äôre golden.

**A few things to note: the RV spots are quite tight, and the utilities are located in the middle of each site, which makes it less comfortable to sit outside your camper and enjoy the view. It‚Äôs not ideal for outdoor lounging, but manageable if you're mostly there for beach access.

Whether you're here for a weekend escape or a longer stay, Dockweiler offers a rare combo of beach access, city convenience, and laid-back vibes. Just be ready for a airplane noise‚Äîit‚Äôs right near LAX‚Äîbut honestly, the ocean makes up for it.

Highly recommend for beach lovers, dog owners, and anyone who wants to camp with a view! üåÖ

south-lake-tahoe-ca-camp-richardson-reso.editorialSummary: Rustic hotel & cabins at a woodsy complex with a marina & restaurant with lake views, plus camping.

reviewSummary.text: Came to Camp Richardson for a fun winter vacation in early January 2025. We stayed in their hotel, which is within walking distance of the beach(which is within the property). Location overall is just a few minutes from town, which was convenient. While we were there we got hit with a winter storm, since the room access is from indoors (from within the hotel itself), it was nice not to track in snow with our shoes when we came back from our ventures. There's free parking on the property for guests, when you check in they give you a parking pass for your vehicle. The room we stayed in was a cute 1 bed 1 bath (bonus points for having a full length mirror by the bathroom). It was perfect for us since we were mainly exploring and out in town for the majority of our stay. Would definitely be back.

Pretty good campground.  Clean, large spaces, generally quiet.  Bathrooms were very clean.  Kinda muddy down near the lake and a 5 min walk.  Great for kids and biking, as well as paddle boarding.  Watch out for Bigfoot!

Small, nice, quiet, clean, easy access. Highly recommended. The RV sites have all necessary hookups (including cable TV). Toilets are very clean and well maintained. Group picnic area available. Great views!

aurora-co-cherry-creek-state-park.editorialSummary: Large park around a reservoir with camping, water sports & many other outdoor leisure activities.

reviewSummary.text: We really loved our stay here!  It's hard to wrap your brain around the fact that you are in the middle of a city.  Massive amount of beautiful, well cared for nature.  Very easy to get in and out with our 40' RV, LOTS of trails and space to walk the dogs (would have been perfect for bike riding), enjoyed fires at night and even saw the northern lights!  Great laundry area (easy to use app so no worries about finding quarters).  Pay showers but I didn't use.  There was a large coyote presence so I would be cautious leaving any small dogs unattended but they pretty much kept their distance.  We loved hearing them at night.  Would love to stay again!

breckenridge-co-tiger-run-resort.editorialSummary: Rustic resort offering mountain views & informal cabins, plus an indoor pool & tennis courts.

reviewSummary.text:
Wanted to like it, but didn‚Äôt.

The positives first, all the residents were super friendly and everyone said hello. Very close to the Colorado trail so great for hiking with our dog.

The negatives, some renovations at the clubhouse meant it was out of action when we arrived. After the renovation it was left dirty in the men‚Äôs restroom. After 10pm (and before 8am the next morning) our access card didn‚Äôt work and we were unable to use the washroom facilities. In the morning I went to the reception to advise them of this and they said there was emergency plumbing work and the water was cut off. I know this was a total lie as a fellow resident did let me in the lounge and I was eventually able to use the restroom. Later that day they posted ‚Äúemergency notices‚Äù for the 10pm - 8am clubhouse/restroom closure.

This was the third RV park we stayed in on our Rockies trip and the largest site. The others all had better bathroom facilities, were cleaner and more polite staff.

Oh and when you are able to use the restroom it inexplicably had four showers, but just one stall‚Ä¶ poorly thought out!

carbondale-co-carbondale-crystal-river-k.editorialSummary: Rustic riverside log cabins with kitchens, plus a clubhouse & an outdoor pool with a sundeck.

reviewSummary.text: This is the second time we've stayed in a cabin for a week during their winter season, and it's the best! The cabin was nice and warm and had everything we needed. I love waking up every morning to an amazing river view. The dog play area is also amazing, it was large and full of grass and our dogs absolutely loved it. Bonus points that we had perfect view of the northern lights from the river this year!

Great little campground overlooking the roaring fork river with Mountain View‚Äôs.  We saw some elk nearby.  Camp hosts were nice and helpful.  Bathrooms were clean. It‚Äôs convenient to Carbondale and Glenwood Springs is about 15-20 minutes by car.  Verizon coverage isn‚Äôt very good.  AT&T is pretty good.  You can use Starlink in some of the spots.

fruita-co-fruita-section-campground.editorialSummary: Park boasting 5 ecological areas with river- & lake-based outdoor recreation activities.

reviewSummary.text: We‚Äôve spent 2025 visiting all 48 lower states in our 5th wheel. Colorado is state 47 of 48 and the campsites and amenities at James Robb State Park are probably the best we‚Äôve seen. Beautiful well maintained and spaced sites on the Colorado River near the Colorado National Monument and Grand Junction Colorado. Highly recommended (November 2025).

Nicely paved .nice bathrooms and showers. Clean laundry room. Dryers are old and take a while. The last one at the end on top is hottest. Your welcome. Grass area for kiddos with games you can get from the office. Small playground for little ones. My grandson spent a little time playing and enjoyed it! We‚Äôve never stayed here and pulled in about 7:30. They had 2 spots left so we snagged one. We are traveling cross country and just stopped to sleep and hang for a bit . Not doing tourist stuff in the area. Got the kids and ourselves all dressed for the pool because across all the states the time is usually 10pm pool close time. and when we got there it said 7pm and after is for adults only. They have adult only RV resorts for that. This is a family friendly place and some people drive in later. That‚Äôs not cool. I‚Äôve never seen that before and was really bummed because we always choose places with pools. .kids have a long day on the road and this is something they look forward to. Jacuzzi was a little dirty. There was some country concert in town I guess. Staff was nice. My son set his scooter to 5 mph like the sign said and some old lady yelled at him to slow down. We were  right there. That‚Äôs unnecessary.  lol some people‚Ä¶‚Ä¶  I think if you don‚Äôt like kids you stay at an adult only place because we were obeying the rules and there was no need to be like that. That‚Äôs what seems better. Mosquitoes were horrendous. The morning time was quiet and I loved the sunrise. Overall nice stay because anywhere you go. there are people and well‚Ä¶.. people are people. üòä a mix of nice and not. Life is beautiful üòç

glenwood-springs-co-glenwood-canyon-reso.editorialSummary: Laid-back resort on the river offering a woodsy accommodations, plus a bar/grill & activities.

reviewSummary.text: We stayed in a Rustic Riverside cabin in September. The cabins are cute and clean, plenty of space for 2 adults and our kiddo. It was nice having electricity while ‚Äúcamping.‚Äù Cabin was directly on the Colorado River, and the leaves were changing - beautiful view! We saw lots of fly fishermen and whitewater rafters going by. The only downside of the location is the very noisy trains that pass by directly on the other side of the river at all hours of the day and night. The campground was quite busy and crowded on the weekend, but remarkably quiet at night (save for the trains). It felt very safe and family friendly. The bathrooms are a literal hike away, up a set of (well-lit) steep stairs, but clean and nicely maintained. Showers had hot water and great water pressure. Staff in the campground were friendly and helpful. The camp store closes early so plan ahead if you need to buy ice or firewood. The town of Glenwood Springs is one exit away on I-70 which made an easy commute to all of the activities we wanted to do. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would stay here again.

golden-co-clear-creek-rv-park.editorialSummary: Creekside, all-year RV park close to hiking trails with bathrooms, laundry facilities & free Wi-Fi.

reviewSummary.text:
This is a terrific RV park.  Full hookups, level lots, and right along the creek.  The town of Golden is an easy walk of a few blocks away.
Holly took my reservation over the phone and happened to check me in.  She was so helpful!  First class service!  She even came over to my site to help me back in.
I couldn't ask for better service.
The location to hiking trails is exceptional.  I highly recommend this RV park

We stayed in one of the Airstream RVs at Camp Eddy and were blown away from the moment we stepped inside. Everything was spotless and thoughtfully designed with modern touches throughout. The heater kept us cozy, the beds were super comfortable, and the shower even had plenty of hot water (huge bonus!). And the best part? It‚Äôs right on the river, you can literally walk outside and take in those peaceful views. Such an awesome experience from start to finish. We‚Äôll definitely be back!

littleton-co-chatfield-state-park.editorialSummary: Biking, hiking, camping & boating with scenic views of the foothills & Platte River Valley.

reviewSummary.text: Very good park for boating, fishing, water sports, kayaking, paddleboarding, camping, hiking and walking. Can get very crowded in the summer season. Nice trails, decent camping selection if you book early, lotsa parking. Has a boat ramp and marina. Nice smaller lakes in the park area as well.

I give it four stars for location. The views in Autumn are spectacular! Nice facility's, level rv pads, firepits, grill available.  Be aware of the loop closest to the highway. You will noticeably hear traffic from 5am well into the night.

bear-de-lums-pond-state-park.editorialSummary: 1,790-acre preserve featuring freshwater pond, multipurpose trails, fishing, boat rentals & more.

reviewSummary.text: Beautiful park. We did the whole loop around the pond, which we consider more of a lake, little hilly but very doable about 3.5 hours for us. Had our big water bottles and took note of bathrooms and port a pottys as we went. Next time bringing our kayak.  Looked at camping sites and they looked very nice as well.

We booked their primitive cabin for a 2 night stay this weekend because I had to DJ a wedding 10 minutes away. The price was extremely reasonable and the website photos of the cabin looked like it could be maybe a little uncomfortable. There were 4 of us and we thought this was going to be cramped but to our surprise it was very nice. The beds were actually comfortable and the space was ample to setup a little table inside to eat and the AC was great. We did use the grill and fire pit by the picnic table as well. The bathroom was close, clean and functional. The lady on the phone LeeAnn was extremely nice and so was the gentleman who greeted us there. Very friendly folks. It was close to Rehoboth Beach and although we were not there for that, we went to the local Walmart to get supplies. We are experienced campers and been to many other campgrounds and for the price it was a good value. Nothing negative....All positive....We plan on returning for an actual vacation.

rehoboth-beach-de-delaware-seashore-stat.editorialSummary: Built in 1876, this restored, historic home offers period artifacts, history exhibits & a gift shop.

reviewSummary.text:
It's pretty much just a parking lot to camp or park your RV, camper van to tent. It is right up against the beach though so nice views.

I was at the North inlet side and Mike the site host was very nice.

chiefland-fl-manatee-springs-state-park.editorialSummary: Clear-water spring home to West Indian manatees is a popular spot for scuba divers & snorkelers.

reviewSummary.text: Beautiful spring, perfect for cooling off in the hot weather. The swimming area is quite large. There is a separate ramp that you can use to paddle out into the Suwannee River and canoe/kayak rentals are available at the park. A beautiful boardwalk also takes you down to the river. There is a small concession stand and store, but we didn't visit as we tend to pack lunch and being what we need. We plan on returning in the colder months to hopefully spot some manatees.

clermont-fl-lake-louisa-state-park.editorialSummary: In addition to housing one of the area's only swimmable lakes, this park also boasts scenic views.

reviewSummary.text: This park has been a family favorite for decades. My grandmother started bringing us here in the late 80s. Then we only came to swim in the lake. Over the years we have camped, hiked, even with our dogs and still swim. We haven't tied down a boat yet but you can if you have one. They have bathrooms at the big lake and even a cute little playground for the kids. If you have horses and need a place to walk them this is a safe place for that. The smaller ponds have canoes that you can rent. Miles of walking trails. You can camp in a camper, camp in a tent with the water hookups, or you can camp in a tent out in the middle of nowhere or they even have little cabins that you can rent. You'll often find deer, armadillos, raccoons. I've never seen the pig, but I know they used to have a pig. There's plenty of beauty to be found.

We stayed in the glamping tents and they were wonderful! It was the end of September and the two ACs kept our space cool enough during the day and even chilly at night. Our tent had a medium size fridge and Keurig coffee pot. They are very roomy and comfortable. The bathhouses are cute and well kept (don't forget to bring your own hand soap though). The recreation room is so nice and our son had blast playing pool and ping-pong. Ichetucknee Springs Park is only 5 minutes away and absolutely beautiful.

hollywood-fl-topeekeegee-yugnee-park-cam.editorialSummary: Green space boasting 2 water parks & a swimming lagoon, plus a 2-mile paved walking loop & camping.

reviewSummary.text:
Beautiful, peaceful, and truly a hidden gem!
T.Y. Park is such a wonderful place to unwind and enjoy nature. The moment you walk in, you feel a sense of peace! the lush trees, calm lake, and well-kept walking paths create a relaxing atmosphere that‚Äôs perfect for families, joggers, or anyone who just wants a quiet escape. There are plenty of shaded areas, picnic spots, and open spaces to sit back and enjoy the view. It‚Äôs clean, safe, and full of life without ever feeling crowded. Truly one of the most beautiful and peaceful parks around. A place you‚Äôll want to return to again and again.

inverness-fl-the-cove-resort-and-pub.editorialSummary: Offering local brews on tap, this easygoing haunt with colorful seating serves popular pub grub.

reviewSummary.text: Great food today at The Cove, food and service were all amazingly good! Had the Quesadilla burger and it was truly a unique, flavorful experience. Just an amazing burger. Great beer selection, fantastic food and service (thank you Red)... can't wait to return! Oh and don't forget to irder the chocolate cake for dessert!

jupiter-fl-jonathon-dickinson-state-park.editorialSummary: State park features the Loxahatchee River, mangroves & river swamps for kayaking, canoeing & hiking.

reviewSummary.text: Been 28 years since I last stayed here. Stayed at the youth site so somewhat away from the rest of the camps. I'd probably give it a 5 star if I was able to enjoy the park more as they have mountain biking, hiking, and some other water borne stuff that I couldn't partake in, sadly. Large park so plenty of room to stretch your arms. Rangers were great! Very helpful and responsive, truly appreciated. The negatives which can and cannot be fixed were the late night trains that run through the park, the mosquitoes the size of VWs, and the observation tower being closed. So go to bed tired, lather on the bug spray (didn't even phase them), and you still get a decent view from the "mountain" top.

photos.attribution: Jenni Sosnow, Your Pet Friendly Real Estate Agent

miami-fl-larry-penny-thompson-park-campg.editorialSummary: Camping area with 270 acres of natural woodland, bridle trails, hiking paths & a freshwater lake.

reviewSummary.text: This place definitely is one of the best RV parks in Miami very organized. Everything has been updated. The RV slots are large and easy to maneuver in and out of and if the nature isn‚Äôt enough for you, you can always go around the back to 152nd St. and go to one of the best zoos in the nation. Happy trails.

photos.attribution: Larry and Penny Thompson Memorial Park and Campground

reviewSummary.text: We are down in FL for a family emergency. The owner & hosts here have really accommodated us, ensuring our stay has been quiet and a place we can relax and unwind.  Everyone has been very friendly and nice. It's a fun mix of short-term and long-term guests and the facilities are always clean. Being able to bike out of the campground directly onto the paved bike trail is awesome.

orlando-fl-bill-frederick-park-at-turkey.editorialSummary: This 183-acre park on Turkey Lake offers fishing, boating & a playground, plus cabin & tent camping.

reviewSummary.text: This review is specifically for the Family RV Park there. We stayed 8 nights in our motorhome while attending a convention at Orange County Convention Center. It worked out very well for us. The drive to the Convention Center was not bad even with the construction. The site was concrete, but it is pretty narrow and not exactly level, but it worked. I saw a few sites with wider areas for the picnic table that enabled you to step out of the RV onto pavement instead of dirt. I checked out the restrooms and they were hot, but we did not use them. There is a swimming pool, but it charges a daily fee. The walking/biking path that goes all the way around the park is very nice. They have a designated dog area that is not fenced in and dog bags all around the park. I would stay there again. We wanted to extend our stay, but they were closing the entire park for tree maintenance. I'm glad they are doing that, because we hit a limb and it knocked out our antenna. We have not yet climbed on top yet to figure out the problem.

Impressive for such a small, rural and economically depressed community.  This facility on Florida's largest freshwater lake is very well designed, but the men's room could use some serious maintenance!

Water toxicity warnings are posted due to algae bloom. Keep fighting, @CaptainsForCleanWater!

palm-harbor-fl-caladesi-rv-park.editorialSummary: Homey RV campground with a heated outdoor pool & a bike trail, plus social activities.

reviewSummary.text: Moved from a "concrete jungle" RV park to Caladesi just yesterday and I LOVE it! There is so much beautiful "old Florida" nature here. Chris and Amanda  have been amazing, helping me with everything. There is also a nice & clean pool, an air conditioned laundry room, clubhouse, restrooms with showers and a weight room! The Pinellas Trail, for biking and walking, is very close. Also a lot of restaurants and even a family owned vegetable stand down the road. Took the "Jolly Trolley" today that has many routes (To Clearwater, Tarpon Springs, etc). Very convenient as I don't have my car here. I highly recommend this place!

palm-harbor-fl-sherwood-forest-rv-park.editorialSummary: Campground featuring tent & RV sites, plus a heated pool, a modest lake, restrooms & laundry.

reviewSummary.text: Absolutely beautiful RV park! We stayed for a month with our kids and dog and they were amazing. The ladies at the front desk were very helpful and friendly. The bathrooms were exceptional! Great water pressure and very clean. The pool was very nice and our kids loved it. The lake is beautiful and we had a wonderful time. Very quiet and peaceful. I recommend it for sure. Not a lot of kids but it‚Äôs in a great location for families. Tons of stuff around to do. Right near Clearwater beach and Pinellas trail. Visit Sherwood RV park if you‚Äôre in Palm Harbor!! Thanks for a great time!!

My sister and her husband stayed here for three nights right on the Ochlocknee River with a great view and a little cabana and picnic table at each waterfront site. There are sites located away from the shore and cost a little less. There is a dock for fishing off of as part of the park. Prices are very reasonable. There is a little store at the Bridge intersection for picking up those little things you may have forgotten and Panacea is not far away either. Great place to spend a weekend. Very quiet too. Dog friendly.

I absolutely loved our night here. The beds were super comfy, the room was clean and spacious with cute seaside decor. We stayed on new years eve, and were a little worried about noise since we were in a room facing the road. The lovely owner & staff found us an air cleaner to run for white noise, and we had a fabulous, quiet night of sleep! The owners are lovely people who have created a wonderful place to relax.

photos.attribution: The Oaks Rv Resort And Motel
The Oaks Rv Resort And Motel
The Oaks Rv Resort And Motel

sanibel-fl-periwinkle-park-and-campgroun.editorialSummary: This straightforward campground for motorhomes & tents also offers showers & laundry facilities.

reviewSummary.text: Loved our stay at Periwinkle Park. The folks are so friendly, and this is coming from a Texan‚Ä¶ we know no strangers. We spent just under a week here on a cross country road trip. The park is beautiful, the beach is perfection, and Sanibel island as a whole is heaven on earth. We could stay here forever.

santa-rosa-beach-fl-grayton-beach-state-.editorialSummary: 2,000-acre park offering ocean swimming, a boat ramp on a lake, hiking & biking trails, & camping.

reviewSummary.text: Grayton Beach State Park is an absolute gem along the Emerald Coast. Not only do you get the gorgeous sugar-white sand and emerald waters, but there‚Äôs so much more. You can have a lovely picnic, take a relaxing nature walk on the trails, and even rent a kayak or paddleboard to explore the coastal dune lake. It‚Äôs the perfect spot to enjoy a little piece of Florida‚Äôs natural beauty

santa-rosa-beach-fl-topsail-hill-preserv.editorialSummary: Park filled with secluded beaches, dune lakes, fishing & camping options, plus amenities for RVs.

reviewSummary.text:
We‚Äôve stayed here twice‚Äîonce in a camper and then last week in a tent. Both are good, but the tent sites are exceptional: fine gravel pads, clothes lines for towels and such, beautiful natural feel, and close proximity to restrooms and showers.

The beach, too, is great. Especially for kids, kayaks, and paddle boards. If you are into shelling you‚Äôll want to visit some other beaches further to the east as SoWal beaches have next to no shells.

While there we saw bald eagles, a gator, pods of dolphins, and a couple small sharks. The beach itself is pristine and separate from the glut of development that comprises much of 30A. .

Lovely ride along the limerock road they keep it grated around to the spring, I hadn't been there since 2010 when Suwannee River garden club had their Christmas party, the year I was elected president , some of you remember, found a tiny purple specimen by the huge oak tree, bell shaped..
The park was $3. To get in 2$ for washing machine, the heated pool looked nice, lots of veterans and all around nice quiet place to hang on a blistering hot day.

Much quieter than Hart, we went last week , way to crowded and loud for me, just right for young adults.

When you come out you can go right along the swamp seeing cypress trees and many knees, my friend calls nuns..
That will bring you to Shingle Landing where the three cypress are located.

Beautiful ride lots to see , spring flowers blooming their hearts out üíï

jekyll-island-ga-jekyll-island-state-par.editorialSummary: State-managed island offering many recreational & water-based activities, from biking to fishing.

reviewSummary.text: Very cool Island, tons of wildlife and scenery.  Palmetto forests and coastal marshes and waterways.  Went in September and the temperature was perfect.  Island is perfect for touring via bicycles. Will definitely be coming back.

Every time we stop by to spend time here it is always peaceful and beautiful. Everything is very well maintained compared to the places that we have traveled. It is an amazing place for just a quick getaway or time with the family. Highly recommended.

Stayed for a short weekend. Lovely spot backed up to the greenbelt. We were sad that part of the path was under construction so we could only walk a short distance. Otherwise would have had to load up the car and drive to access the greenbelt. Park was quiet, able to walk the dogs all over the park without any issues. Didn't use the facilities except the dump site which was fine and I think the only comment in the negative would be the gal at check-in wasn't the friendliest. It is always nice when you walk into an establishment to get a warm greeting and welcome especially being in the hospitality business. Otherwise stay was fine.

This is a perfect stop when riding The Coeur D‚ÄôAlene Bike Trail. It is directly off the trail and there are pretty spots right along the bend of the river. There are good toilets and showers, and a good restaurant close by. Emerald was extremely helpful and accommodating.

This is a great adventure as much as it is a little hidden Gem right off of I90.  I took a day trip from Spokane roughly an hour and 20 minute drive give or take. There is an RV Park attached to it that looked really nice. I choose to do the Mother load package and it was a blast. My inner child was extremely happy.  Learning about the mine and seeing the Veins of quartz from small to big was absolutely amazing.  It does have some low points you have to duck your head on other wise it is pretty accessible.  I do not recommend taking wheel chairs or if you have any difficulties walking on slick surfaces. There is fun to be had for the whole family from the gift shop, the mine tour, panning for gold or gemstones, digging for fossils, and an arcade game that you can shoot the star out to win a prize (I was close).  I spent about 2 hours here and it was amazing worth the trip.  The pricing is really affordable with different packages. Need a day adventure or even a weekend adventure I would truly check this place out.  I know I will be back!

This RV park is in a great location and walkable to the town. The town is a small, quaint, historical and well preserved. There are many things to do in the area including a bordello tour, mining tour and the Hiawatha trail was a highlight! The RV park has full hook ups and our sites were backed up to a creek. The noise of the creek was perfect and gives the right sound for a good night‚Äôs sleep. They had plenty of ice and it was very affordable. Staff was friendly and efficient. I recommend this location. There is a restaurant at the RV park with good food and  service.

A great campground! Great location, great price! Shame about the bugs!

We loved staying here for a few days while we explored St Louis and its surrounds, the view was stunning, and facilities were well maintained. Staff were friendly and helpful.

The only downside was the amount of bugs and mosquitoes! It was really bad, and meant we didn‚Äôt sit outside as much, as you just couldn‚Äôt get away from them.

A great stay, minus our 100 new bug bites!

We stayed here on our way across the country. We found them accessible, friendly, trustworthy and easy. The campground was adjacent to a beautiful cornfield. The sites are level, we did not even have to unhook. Perfect for our overnight needs. I would highly recommend it for an extended stay or on your way across country!

This small campground in Karnak, IL is situated perfectly adjacent to the Tunnel Hill trail.   Sites available with electric, electric and water and, electric water and sewer.  Although not a lot of privacy the sites are spaced out pretty well.  Good place for RV's, trailers and tents.

Wow, 10 stars for everything. Our hosts were so helpfull and it was such a heartwarming community. I was made to feel as part of the community immediately. Very beautiful and kept very clean. I got a 5 mile walk into town on the trail that was very peaceful and filled with waterfowl. You will see some in the pics. The kids road their bikes the other direction and said it was amazing as well. Thanks for a very welcoming stay. I will definitely be back. I recommend it to all !!!!! Don't miss it if you are in the area

First time visit, camped here for 2 night.   Campground, nothing fancy but clean and well kept. We did the museum and the canal ride. Great small attraction,  knowledgeable volunteers willing to share their knowledge, i would recommend a visit.

evansville-in-burdette-park-campground.editorialSummary: Huge, 170-acre park & recreation area featuring mini-golf, waterslides, playgrounds & more.

reviewSummary.text: The water park was nice. The chalets need some serious help. They are run down. Not very clean. Need to be updated. Especially for the price. Plus you have zero privacy if you have the bed near the hot tub. They need to build in a wall and a door. If you have a group of people staying w you. You can't use the tub. With our everyone hearing everything. Big let down.

lafayette-in-prophetstown-state-park.editorialSummary: Diverse terrain for hiking, biking, birding, camping & more, plus working farm with public programs.

reviewSummary.text:
I absolutely love this park! It‚Äôs my favorite place in Greater Lafayette. My family and I come here often‚Äîfor various events and just for fun. We enjoy the splash park, the playground, and the overall friendly atmosphere.

One of the highlights was visiting the nearby farm. It‚Äôs such a fun and amazing place where you can see and pet different animals, ride on a tractor, dance square dances, and enjoy delicious burgers, hot dogs, and refreshing lemonade. The live music made the experience even better.

A perfect spot for family time, great memories, and lots of fun!

north-vernon-in-muscatatuck-park-campgro.editorialSummary: Spacious forested park offers riverfront hiking trails, a campground, visitor center & picnic space.

reviewSummary.text: We camped here for 2 nights. A lovely in town park and campground is well maintained, clean with options of full hook-ups, electric/water only and primitive sites. Not crowded in May. Dump station also away. This park has hiking, running and biking trails. Caters to locals and out of towners passing through.

Great location, right next to local shops and the flea market. Definitely worth a stopover. Staff is wonderful, helpful and kind. Lots to do within walking distance. Clean, modern bathrooms and showers.
Why 4 stars and not 5? Laundry facilities. The dryers only run for 10 minutes at a time. By the time they've heated, they start the cool-down cycle. Then you've got to start again, adding quarters for another 10 minutes. Took way longer than necessary to dry clothes and you had to go back to the machine to add money every few minutes. Obviously, staff is aware of this and there's a sign pointing it out.  Instead of a sign, the recommendation would be to fix the problem.

Enjoyed our stay at Prairie bridges park. Park offers multiple play grounds and multiple ponds to fish from. Park has long trails some paved some gravel and grass. Bathhouse was nice. Host was friendly and was easy to get a reservation. Offer gator loads of wood also. Would definitely come back for another stay.

Just returned from a long three day weekend. This is a beautiful place. Ponds, playgrounds, entertainment, clean bathhouse and a fantastic camp host name Chuck!  Greet welcome and directions of where to set up at. Very accommodating and friendly. Wood for sale there. Casey‚Äôs close by and the great town of Allison is close for groceries and more. We visited various other small towns in the area.
Put this on your list my friends. Worth a stay.
Jrangel
DBQ, IA.

anita-ia-lake-anita-state-park.editorialSummary: Modern campgrounds & nature trails surrounding a 171-acre lake with boating, fishing & more.

reviewSummary.text: The park grounds are pretty and the facilities are clean. We were not very impressed with the actual campsites, however. They are very narrow and most of the site's fire pits are too close the neighbor's spot, making it impossible to sit around them. At the full hookup sites, the fire pit was next to the neighbor's septic hookup. There were also a TON of flies. I'm not sure if it was just the time of year, or if it was related to the septic system but it was excessive. Lovely park, but I probably won't camp here again.

This campground met our needs, had pretty views, and lots of space to play and roam. We had an RV & two tents. The host was very helpful and hospitable. The sites themselves were quite spacious. There isn‚Äôt much for shade at the campground, but they have planted many young trees. Bring bikes or your walking shoes for the nice paved paths. On our late June visit, there was a resident heron flying over the lake and our boys (7 & 10) played a pick up game of wiffle ball with some of the other campers. Bare bones, but fairly clean amenities.
Eastside shelter was a perfect place for a small wedding. Loved being able to rent bison and deer ridge cabins. Just wish there was an option that didn't require you to clean
Nice level lots, roomy, pull through, full hookup.  Some can be reserved,  others 1st come. Only stayed 1 night, but I put in my return book.

cedar-falls-ia-black-hawk-park-campgroun.editorialSummary: Rustic 1,490-acre green space with campgrounds & river access, plus a popular gun & archery range.

reviewSummary.text: Very relaxed atmosphere. You can hang hammocks. Which is something we really enjoy doing. Play ground is a little mediocre, but hey, they still have one! Lol, shower house is built up due to possible flooding. One side has stairs and the other a ramp. Showers are pull chain and HOT! Pet friendly. Very helpful staff.

First and foremost, we are full-time RVs since 2022 and had the privilege to visit plenty RV parks and resorts. From county parks to state parks to luxury RV resorts we visited all kinds of properties. With that said we found that we enjoy campsites that are leveled, easy access, big rig, friendly, and easy to navigate throughout the RV park.

We found none of those things once we pulled into this RV park! Unfortunately, yes, this is self service, but there is no CLEAR direction whatsoever once you enter the campground.

When I called to make a reservation, I was instructed by the gentleman to call as I arrive so he could provide directions. I called 30 mins prior to arrival ‚Ä¶.. but no answer.

Once you arrive, you‚Äôre instructed to go to the Laundry house to register. I knocked, walked in but the place was empty.

I read the signage and filled out a form and grabbed a map.

Now I‚Äôve seen PLENTY maps and understand logistics but this was extremely confusing. Typically, you see different colors to indicate whether it‚Äôs a 30 amp spot or 50 amp. We need something long with full hookups, which the gentleman on the phone confirmed.

After this ‚Ä¶. You‚Äôre basically on your own, I decided to get off instead of having my husband pull the rig around since it‚Äôs a big rig.

But we found that we basically have to drive around to locate a semi level spot.

We tried a couple different sites, but most of them were EXTREMELY un-level & there was NO WAY we would‚Äôve been able to level the rig even with all of the right tools. (Which we did.)

The other disadvantage is there‚Äôs no signage for the sites, which made it even harder to navigate throughout the park. The picnic tables are extremely worn and would have some safety concerns. Lastly, the park is surrounded by homes ‚Ä¶. The site we ended up at (NWT29) was the backyard of one of those houses. Zero privacy for the home owners or us.

Half of the park was closed offer which appeared to be a little nicer and more level, however, the rest of the park was extremely trashy, dirty and appeared abandoned.

Lastly, the final thing to point out if you have a big rig ‚Ä¶. GPS took us to 200th St & Clark St ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ which was EXTREMELY TIGHT TO TURN onto Clark St. We cringed as we made the turn. üò¨

Not sure how this place got an 8.9 review and why others have stated this was a nice park because it‚Äôs anything but. Not to mention the convenient /liquor store in front of the campground which should‚Äôve been our first instinct to RUN!

Needless to say this our LEAST favorite stay. It‚Äôs only a one nighter so we‚Äôll make it work but anyone with a BIG RIG 40 foot + should really reconsider.

I would not recommend staying here.

council-bluffs-ia-lake-manawa-state-park.editorialSummary: Hiking/biking trails & a lake for swimming, boating & fishing, plus modern campgrounds.

reviewSummary.text: We parked in the RV park for 4 nights in site 36. A beautiful water view site facing West. The RV park at Lake Manawa State Park has full-hookup sites with flat, level concrete pads and patios that make setting up easy. Many of the sites open up to pretty water views where you can catch both sunrise and sunset over the lake. The campground has clean bathrooms and showers, plus a dump station, and it‚Äôs close to the ‚ÄúBig Dream‚Äù Playground that‚Äôs perfect for kids. Each site comes with a picnic table and fire ring, and the gated entry keeps things quiet and secure.

eldora-ia-pine-lake-state-park.editorialSummary: Wooded park featuring cabins & a lodge for rental, plus campgrounds, trails & a river.

reviewSummary.text: Peaceful place for fishing on the bank. I drove up here over a holiday weekend, so I was pleasantly surprised to see that it wasn‚Äôt crowded. There were others, but we found a great place on the bank to enjoy the space while the girls caught a variety of small fish. Bringing your own lawn chairs would probably be a good idea if you want to sit.

Beautiful park. I haven't used the camp ground or cabins yet but the trials are great. There are paved and natural trails. The trails go by a lake, s river, waterfalls, woods, prairie and wetlands. Took me about 2 hours to do most of the trails but I liked the change scenery as the trails went. They were pretty easy and saw people of all ages. I recommend for people in the Webster City area who want to experience nature. You just sit, fish, kayake, or hike around.

photos.attribution: Paris All Lives Matter-Blessings to All
Paris All Lives Matter-Blessings to All

marion-ia-wanatee-park.editorialSummary: Park with campsites & trails for hiking, mountain biking, cross-country skiing & horseback riding.

reviewSummary.text: We have stayed at many dozens of campgrounds all over the country, and this campground had the most spacious and well-kept sites we‚Äôve ever seen. The bathhouse was what you‚Äôd expect at a county park, nothing special. The location was beautiful with bunnies and the most fireflies we‚Äôd ever seen, and it was quiet considering how close you are to civilization.

The campground is kept clean and well maintained.  The staff is very helpful.  They also have discounted passes for the city pool next door, and a trail that takes you over a walking bridge to East Park.

okoboji-ia-emerson-bay-state-recreation-.editorialSummary: Bayside area with a beach, boat ramp & sandy swimming beach, plus a campground with full hookups.

reviewSummary.text: Very well kept area to take your family. I was really impressed with how clean and close by the bathrooms were. Honestly the cleanest I've ever seen by a lake. It was so great to have to dock so close to the beach area as well. Definitely recommend!

The sites were good sized, and not to close to eachother. There is no water hook ups in the sites, but they have 15 amp, 30 amp, and 50 amp electrical hook ups. There are multiple bathhouse but only one shower house. The bathrooms and showers were clean. The shower is free, but it is just a push button. There is no temperature controls for the showers. I did have to push the button a few times before I got warm water.

We have camped here multiple times.  This is one of our favorite campgrounds around the Des Moines area.  The facilities are kept clean and every spot has been great.  There is now 6 dumping stations and that helps with being such a big campground.

$15 for a tent site AND $5 (slightly annoying) for car admission per day. Sites are super clean, hosts are very friendly and attentive to sites. Lose a star because they don't enforce noise restrictions- I'm not going to try and find the site blazing music in a packed campground a quarter mile away after midnight to ask them to turn it down myself.
All summer me and friends walk and clean trash and have fun with our kids.   Camping is fun and clean out there.  I also have fun feeding small animals.  They play with my dog too.
Great campground, great biking trails! Nearby campers had a bike stolen, other then that good times!!
Beautiful campground. Great fishing.  Lots were spacious and the suspension bridge was great.

This campground is a childhood favorite and has continued improving over many years.  I do wish they had more site sewage but not a big deal.  The staff is great and even brought our passes to us at our site‚Ä¶caught a Blue Gill off the dock with a nice fat worm!  Since then another Blue Gill and a Small Mouth Bass have been shared with me by the Lake.  I returned all of them to the Lake. Fifty years of memories at this jewel of Topeka, Kansas.  Learned to water ski here, did Winter camping even in a foot of snow, and many other great times!

Park manager was really nice. We got there late and she waited for us to check us in.
Park was easy access, close to the freeway. But, the driveway was gravel and was washed out from rain. The site was nice and long, we are close to 60' with our class A and two trailer, and it was concrete.
But the grass was overgrown, and looked like it hadn't been mowed in awhile. Most of the rigs there seemed to be long term residents. But it worked for a quick overnight.

lucas-ky-barren-river-lake-state-park-re.editorialSummary: Lakeside resort offering a low-key lodge & cottages, a casual restaurant & an outdoor pool.

reviewSummary.text: Stayed at the lodge for a wedding. Our door did not lock. Looks like the cops busted in recently. There was black mold on the ceiling and bugs everywhere in the room. There were cigarette butts all over the balcony. No microwave or mini-fridge. The room was also unchanged from 1971 other than a 20' flat screen. We got sick from the black mold and left a night early. The restaurant was actually decent.

mandeville-la-fontainbleau-state-park.editorialSummary: 2,800-acre park on Lake Pontchartrain with a beach, nature trails, campgrounds & cabins.

reviewSummary.text: It's such a beautiful and eye-soothing place. The scenery is calm and refreshing, perfect for relaxing and enjoying nature. A nice place for picnics with friends or family. The peaceful atmosphere, wide open spaces, and stunning lake view make it an ideal place to spend quality time.

The campground is very nice conveniently located in Brewster which puts you in the cape. That alone is worth its weight and gold. This is our second time there for Labor Day weekend. And we booked for next year as well. So obviously definitely coming back. Off the beaten path. You pull in up a dirt road that is 10 mph as you get closer to the actual campground it drops to 5 mph to keep all of the pedestrians and bicyclists safe obviously. When you first get there you pull off to the right fairly clearly marked you stopped there you check in at the front desk get your tag for your mirror for your car. Campsites are well maintained there is full hook up available, gray water only an electricity, and water on site. There are also sites without water mainly tent sites. The owners which are very present seem to be kind caring and really want the campers to enjoy their stay. The campground is very well kept, bathrooms are clean, plenty of bathrooms and showers, dirt roads throughout for the most part there are a few tard roads to the campsites,. There is also Sweetwater farms which seems to be a horse farm they tell you not to go too close but you can walk by and look at the horses. They have basketball swing sets cornhole pickleball, horseshoes, there's a fishing pond, you can rent boats. Plenty of water spigots throughout the place with buckets to put all your fires. Some really nice tent sites that are kind of tucked away with privacy. Camp store has a good amount of things that you may need when you're camping including camping and tent items, fishing items, milk bread crackers, candies. There is a small arcade game room for the kids with some seating, upstairs from that there is a pool table with some books and people television in that room with some sitting areas. There is a dump station for those that need to dump their campers. When I left check out was at 11:00 and I was second in line for the dump station, as I was dumping one person pulled behind me. So it was not overwhelmingly busy. Also to mention there is mini golf which cost $2.50 per person, or lots of activities planned for the weekend Friday Saturday Sunday. They had things such as scavenger hunt, fishing derby, painting rocks, basketball shootout for the kids, on Sunday they had a live band play quite a few of the campground patrons bring their chairs set up and watch the live band. Also before the live band on Sunday there was catered burgers hot dog salad. All for free.

reviewSummary.text: 10/10 incredible time! The staff was extremely helpful with everything. The entire place was very clean and well kept. They had inside and outside showers which were both great. Our plot for camping was very spacious. They had plenty of supplies you could buy inside their store incase you forgot anything. We will be back!!!!

We had a fabulous time!  John is incredibly friendly and took time out when doing his chores to check on us and make sure that everything was going well with our stay - which added that extra special touch.  Campground was very clean and our site was level.  Bathhouses were clean and well kept.  Very close to Sleeping Bear Dunes and all of the charming lakeshore communities.  We look forward to returning.

This is a nice clean campground, Nice clean showers and bathrooms. An extended nice children's play set! And a paved 1.3 mile walk to city park beach area. Enjoyed walking out on the pier for an amazing sunrise!

photos.attribution: R and R towing R and R Enterprizes LLC

hart-mi-john-gurney-park.editorialSummary: Forested waterfront park providing a campground, sports fields & courts & year-round recreation.

reviewSummary.text: This was one of the smallest yet most peaceful campgrounds we've been to. The view of the lake was amazing. The water pressure is awesome and the water was soft and yummy.  The grounds were very clean and all amenities were well maintained.

Friendly staff and well-maintained. The camp host does a good job and ensuing only campers or visitors of campers come in. It's nice that you don't have to worry about beac visitors driving needlessly through the campsite.  It's all cement parking and no tents can be in sand. You have to bring a fire pit unless you use the ones in the common space. Fire pit has to stay on the blacktop. No alcohol allowed and they will make you dump out your drinks. They inform you of the rules at check-in.

Campsites were great, facilities (bathrooms and showers) were amazing. They felt like hotel standards. Staff was kind, campground was quiet and peaceful. We loved all the beautiful flowers. It was the perfect place to visit all  the surrounding sights to see. Thank you for having us. Victoria

holly-mi-groveland-oaks-county-park.editorialSummary: Campground for RVs, tents & cabins, plus a recreation area by a large lake with swimming & boating.

reviewSummary.text: We came here as a guests visiting Family (that had rented a site) for a Halloween event.  I was delighted with how large and well maintained Groveland Oaks County park is. There are walking paths all throughout, wooden bridges, multiple playgrounds, a lake with a groomed beach, small arcade, cozy camp store, yurts, group sites, full hook-up or tent sites; you truly have a plethora of options available to you. My extended family has camped here multiple times, and they have enjoyed every stay. I would have no problem booking a site for ourselves, for a staycation, next summer after seeing what they have to offer.

We spent 5 nights in our fifth wheel in the upper tier. We loved our view of the canal, however it would been lovely to be at the water‚Äôs edge. The location is phenomenal as you are able to walk to downtown Houghton & use the park as your base to explore the peninsula. We felt the only downsides were the closeness of the sites & the park is part of an atv trail, creating unwanted noise outside our rig.

Klint Safford Memorial Park

An RV park on the Iron River
What an awesome place to stay
We hike the Apple Blossom Trail
Four small towns along the way

The hills form shadows from the East
Remnants of the Sheridan mine
Old structures serve as monuments
A trail that‚Äôs cooled by hardwoods and pine

It follows the Iron River
A UP Blue Ribbon Stream they say
Where else can you walk the blacktop
And fish a trout along the way

There‚Äôs one more trail just to the West
You‚Äôll hear the ORVs
The endless Offroad trails begin
They snake cross- country through the trees

There‚Äôs something UP here for everyone
Great views from great elevations
History, wilderness and water
My Iron County vacation

kalamazoo-mi-markin-glen-county-park.editorialSummary: Former private estate with hiking trails, ball fields, a swimming lake & a 38-site campground.

reviewSummary.text:
Great place to bring the family for a day of hiking, swimming and grilling. Plenty to do for the little ones with their 2 playgrounds and sandy beach as well as several fishing piers for catch and release in the stocked stream fed lake. If you're into mountain biking there are 5 miles of beginner to advanced trails including some pretty gnarly "Rocks & Roots" type trails.
* Addition:  Today my dog and I decided to check out the park on the "other" side of the road and I wish I could say don't bother but I just can't lie so.... I really wanted to keep this info to myself but i wouldn't be able to sleep if I did that. The other park is AMAZING! If you like secluded private, quiet, hidden, retro type outdoor places that are tucked back in the woods literally looking like a forgotten time. I was so surprised after we walked 1/4 mile back into the woods and found this place and I'm not kidding it's even got a playground with a steel slide straight out of 1982!! What a treasure!!

This is a fantastic campground. We enjoy having our RV here as a Basecamp while we explore the area. So many nice campsites and extremely good staff. There is a mountain bike track that is a blast. The playground in the park is very cool with lots of nice equipment. Climbing wall, etc. Makes us wish we were kids again üòÑ The bathhouses and restrooms are fairly new and very well set up. The staff at the park keep them very clean and nicely stocked. They are also friendly people to chat with! Very good camping for the doggos. The trail goes to a Bark Park also.

marquette-mi-marquette-tourist-park-camp.editorialSummary: Amenities at this RV/tent campground include BBQ pits, picnic tables, restrooms, showers & a beach.

reviewSummary.text: The park is located next to a wide paved bike path that gets you everywhere in Marquette. The University is just a couple of blocks away. The park is quiet, clean and has very helpful staff. Reasonably priced, with limited full hook-ups, and some pull through sites available.

monroe-mi-sterling-state-park.editorialSummary: Lake Erie's only state park offers 1 mile of lakeshore with campsites plus wildlife walks & hiking.

reviewSummary.text: The park offers some good points, but the beach could use some improvement. The beach itself was just okay and not as clean as I would have liked. However, I did appreciate the shaded areas provided by the trees, which was a nice break from the sun. The park play area for kids was a great feature and a definite plus."

Nice campground with a great location having the the bicycle trail behind our lot and across the street is beautiful White Lake for boating and kayaking.  Also, a great location for spending time in the beautiful towns of Montague and Whitehall.

This was our first time at Duck Creek. The property is beautifully maintained, and the staff very friendly. We stayed at site 159. It was spacious and level, and the main attractions were literally in our "back yard". A gas grill would have been a nice addition to the site.
Our crew had a blast in the water areas, but we were confused why ALL of the water activities don't operate with the same hours. The splash pad/lazy river/slides don't even open until 12pm, then they close at 6pm (while everything else runs 9am-9pm). We also found seating at the water areas to be tricky, especially at the start of the day. We got a cabana one day, and decided to save the $100 and wing it the other two. People start to line up about a half hour before the water park area opens, then rush in Black Friday style to secure seats. The shade spots are obviously the first to go. We have been to several water park camping resorts over the years, and this is the first time we have run into this issue.
Overall the fun we had outweighed our minor irritations, and they really did a nice job providing something for everyone. Would visit again!

This was such a kind and hospitable campground. The staff and other campers felt like friends by the end of our trip. We were able to get on the river right from the campground. Very clean bathroom facilities. Beautiful mature trees around the sites. The park is a great amenity to have right on site, with a well maintained volleyball court. Beautiful landscaping. Overall amazing vibes.

We had a great stay. We stayed 4 nights/5 days. We never experienced the bad smells from the sewage treatment plant, but perhaps it is worse during certain times.

We were there mostly to bike the Wheelway. The trail goes right through camp which was very convenient. We would come again.

petoskey-mi-sun-outdoors-petoskey-bay-ha.editorialSummary: High-end RV retreat featuring lush grounds, an outdoor pool, golf, an elegant lodge & a gym.

reviewSummary.text:
Wow can't say enough good things about this place, we will definitely be back here.Everything clean.It's so nice to have your own little, tiny home. Close to everything. Also liked that it was a gated community felt really safe. Having a bonfire relaxing on your porch is the ideal vacation. I will never stay in a hotel again. Also, if you get hungry, there's a beautiful breakfast placed at Bay harbor it's called Maple and batter.
You all need to go. It's only five minutes from this place. Getting ready to schedule our next vacation. Really soon here just go. You won't be sorry.
It's also a very quiet place.

I‚Äôve tent-camped at Kal Haven twice, and both times were great experiences. It‚Äôs a large, well-kept property with a nice shower house/restrooms and a very convenient on-site store (with free coffee). It‚Äôs off the beaten path a bit, but still close to South Haven, and not nearly as crowded or noisy as nearby state park campgrounds. I‚Äôd definitely camp here again.

So very disappointed.   Reserved for 3 nights for week before Memorial Day.  Arrived Monday and there were only 2 other sites that had occupants out of 20.  Very unusual for camping before a holiday.  It was not well maintained but location ideal for walking to town and beach.  Woke up this morning to no power and now only people there.  Found out bill hadn't been paid and electricity had been shut off by power company.
We asked for money back.  Now our vacation was cut short.
Very unprofessional!
Find somewhere else!

We had a very fun time celebrating 90th birthday at the shelter next to the dam.  Catered food from local grocery store was very delicious, especially the chicken. Thanks for a great day to celebrate family!

Very busy campground this weekend. For a city-owned campground my opinion is it should be upgraded considerably. Should have outhouses around the whole campground instead of one toilet and bath House. On construction sites they have to have one outhouse for every eight people for osha rules. But here they can have hundreds of people and just bath house with three toilets. They were very dirty and the sign said they were cleaned at noon each day. Out of paper towels. Floor was very muddy .The grounds were very wet and a RV got stuck in his campsite and had to be pulled out by a tow truck. Instead of fixing the site they rented it the next state of somebody else. The trails going through the woods down to the fishing pier we're untouched and you'd think that somebody could trim them out so you could walk through. I know there's nothing they can do about it but the train's going by constantly make it Very noisy. Come on city of Duluth! Step up and make some improvements!

east-grand-forks-mn-red-river-state-recr.editorialSummary: This riverside green space with numerous R.V. hookups offers areas for biking, fishing & boating.

reviewSummary.text:
Such a nice spot to camp! The hosts were helpful and friendly. They were waiting on some final documents from the city to open the shower but they let us in with a disclaimer to not drink any of the water because they didn‚Äôt have the final papers for potability. We stayed on an electric only site. There was so much to do in walking distance.

Cost: $30-$45/night
Privacy: limited/nonexistent
Ease of access: very easy
Views/Scenery: this campground is in a large town, near a road, but the campground itself has a large green space and a flood barrier berm so there is a bit of nature to be seen. It also sits next to a large river. There are paved walkways that follow the river, and allow bikes to be ridden.
Cell reception: very good- 4-5 bars on Cricket wireless
Crowded: we were here the first week it was opened after winter, so there were very few others around. The campground hosts said it gets pretty busy and they get full many weekends.
Noise: this should be a definite consideration if you plan to stay here. It is (like I said) in a large town and the campground is adjacent to a busy road, so you will have daytime road noise. The fire station is just on the other side of the flood berm so every time they go out on a call, you‚Äôre going to have sirens. It happened frequently the 3 days we stayed here. Also, there is a city warning alarm that they run a test on during the day (it lasted about 60 seconds on a Wednesday around lunch). It‚Äôs very loud and you shouldn‚Äôt expect to be able to sleep through their test, if you‚Äôre a day sleeper.
Wildlife: minimal- squirrels and birds
Distance from nearest town: walking distance to shops (

The new managers are absolutely amazing. So glad they have new ones for many reasons.  They are kind people and will go out of their way to accommodate their campers. They're more than happy to deliver your wood to your site, the bathrooms/showers are cleaner than they ever have been in all the years we've camped here. The sites are always well maintained, the grass, fire pits, tree branches, etc. I can't say enough nice things about this campground and the managers. Thank you for being lovely people!!!! üòä

This was our second stay at West 40 and we were there for 10 days.  We're not in their target demographic and I was a little concerned about possible late night noise from the off-roaders.  I was pleased that all the nights were quiet.  It was a great change of scenery from our travels in Iowa and Missouri.

Paul and Chuck are great owner/managers and Casey gave just the right amount of attention as campground host.  We have already reserved for the same time next year.  We even invited friends to join us this year and they loved it too.

photos.attribution: West Forty RV Park and Campground
