This is a very nice State Park and its very popular, particularly with surfers and saltwater fishermen. The beaches on both the north and south sides of the inlet are nice, but you have to be careful when there is any kind of storm brewing in the Atlantic because they rip currents can get very dangerous.  There is also a nice and calm swimming lagoon on the north side and to the west of US Hwy A1A where it's safe for kids to swim.  There are also lots of pavilions and picnic tables available.  There is a concession building on the north side of the inlet near the jetty, but it's still closed after getting ravaged by hurricanes over the past few years.  We did notice there were two food truck vendors parked in the area under the north off ramp of the bridge.   It does get very hot and buggy here during the summer months, but the winter months in this area are delightfully pleasant with low humidity and mostly clear skies.   If you are "Glamper" like my wife and I (i.e., we don't cook at the campsite, but rather dine out), then you will have to drive about 12 miles south to Vero Beach, or about 15 miles north to Melbourne Beach to find any restaurants.  Vero Beach has several very good restaurants that run the full gambit of shabby to sheik.  Melbourne Beach only has a small handful, but we at a place up there called Sand on the Beach that wasn't too bad.

micanopy-fl-paynes-prairie-preserve-stat.editorialSummary: State preserve with various wildlife habitats & trails for hiking, horseback riding & bicycling.

reviewSummary.text:
Make sure you go to the visitor‚Äôs center first so you can get the map‚Äîthe distance of each trail is clearly marked while the online map is useful, it doesn‚Äôt show that. They can also tell you the best times/places to see the alligators, wild horses, and bison. We saw all of them except the bison‚Äîwhich haven‚Äôt been seen in a while because of the hot weather.

The observation tower by the visitor‚Äôs center is breath taking. Beautiful, spacious wild area.

ocala-fl-santos-trailhead-campground.editorialSummary: Campground & trailhead with restrooms, water, picnic pavilions & access to mountain-biking trails.

reviewSummary.text: Great little campground next to the trails at Santos in Ocala. 25 sites and 1 bathroom. Last star was for facilities as the men's room had 1 toilet. Campground roads are well paved and sites are decently level.  Close access to hiking, paved biking, walking and some of the best mountain bike trails in Florida made the campground a must stay. If the facilities were improved and cleaned more regularly I would move here happily.  Close stores for food and necessities as well as thrift stores and antiques.

orange-city-fl-blue-spring-state-park.editorialSummary: Park featuring a cool-water spring on the St. Johns River that's popular for swimming & kayaking.

reviewSummary.text: Blue Spring State Park is beautiful! The spring runs into the St. John's River and pushes out 100 million gallons of water a day. The boardwalk is wide and elevated with several lookouts that provide expansive views of the spring and aquatic life. If you love observing manatees, this is the place for you. On the day that I visited manatees were all over the place, even at my feet. Hundreds of fish were visible. The park is a great place for canoeing, kayaking, snorkeling, scuba, and camping. I am going back to stay in one of the cabins. The park is also a great place if you enjoy primative camping but there is a bath house, water spigot, and fire pit. My advice? GO!!!

osprey-fl-oscar-scherer-state-park.editorialSummary: Acres of woods & water for camping, swimming, fishing, canoeing & hiking miles of trails.

reviewSummary.text: Nice State Park with hiking, walking and cycling trails, cheap admission fees. Plenty of native plants and fauna to watch and even a man-made lake to fish if you desire. Ample pavilion areas for family activity and get togethers. Very clean bathrooms as well.

pensacola-beach-fl-fort-pickens-campgrou.editorialSummary: An RV and tent-friendly park with 200 campsites offering water, electricity & grill areas,

reviewSummary.text: Great place to camp for a short stay.  Camped in Loop C with a 37' motorhome.  Site was clean and well maintained with 50amp electric and water hookup at the site. They are very particular about not parking your tow vehicle on the grass since it does damage that costs the National Park money. There is overflow parking available if needed but it's limited so try to book a site long enough to fit all your vehicles.  You cannot park your tow vehicle parallel on your site.  All vehicles must be parked pulled straight in on your pad.  You will receive a citation if parked the wrong way or touching the grass.  Cell service on Verizon and T-Mobile is very slow and sometimes doesn't work at all. Check the Blue Angels practice dates on their website and you'll be able to view them flying over Fort Pickens. Best viewing is from the actual fort along the seawall.

saint-petersburg-fl-fort-de-soto-park-ca.editorialSummary: 238-site, waterfront campground with RV hookups, showers, grills & picnic tables, plus a camp store.

reviewSummary.text:
Why is the reason to have pets and no pets area? I visited many other campgrounds in Florida (we are locals), Georgia and Tennessee which they are either pet or not at all.
This is my 2nd opportunity staying on this campground. On this second time we decided to take a look at no pet area. It seems much cleaner with barely any debris on the ground. On our 1st visit 3 years ago the site was on fair condition. This time our site 112 was a swamp. This site was next to the outside road. It did smell and look like it too. On our 3 days we didn't see anyone cleaning those when people head out of their sites. On the no pets we noticed sites getting clean and even a digger leveling sites that look much better than ours with fresh gravel/dirt. We never used their table nor the grill. You can even notice how some grill have burned/use charcoal. I get the user MUST be polite to those coming behind, but not even those at the campsite. And yes it can be very dusty as others pointed out. They'll get the ground wet the help with it.

sebring-fl-highlands-hammock-state-park.editorialSummary: Huge park offers full camping facilities, trails & wildlife in an old-growth cypress swamp.

reviewSummary.text: Neat place to enjoy nature! Bug spray reccomended. The Cyprus trees are my favorite. Lots of trails. Saw some water snakes and wild dogs.

Thanks to an earlier than usual check-in. My wife and I were able to get in an excellent round-trip ride to Plummer before the rain came. The suggestion to have lunch at the Gateway diner was excellent. Mike greeted us when we arrived and made our one night visit here very easy.

Great place for breakfast. I wouldn't know about much else.
Staff is extremely attentive, and the food Wow!
Hopefully y'all enjoy as much as we did

grafton-il-pere-marquette-state-park.editorialSummary: Lodge & 8,000-acre nature area for water & winter sports, birding, hunting, riding & camping.

reviewSummary.text:
This park is a nature's lovers paradise. Located in Grafton Illinois at the confluence of the Mississippi and Illinois Rivers.

We took the main circle drive thru the park which had many pull offs for you to get out and enjoy the views. Unfortunately we never made it back to see the main Lodge.

A great park for camping and hiking. The visitors center open daily from 8-3pm. Plenty of parking as well as public facilities thru out.

I did a bike packing trip from Chicago. I loved it so much that I stayed a 2nd night!This place is a gem!  The setting is beautiful; this campground is extremely well-maintained.  The shower rooms and bathrooms are very clean. The staff is friendly and helpful. The manger, Elaine, was most gracious, accommodating  and kind.
You get a bucket of firewood at no charge!  You do hear a little traffic but it's not bad. Some people have commented that you could do better in Wisconsin or Michigan, but that's like comparing apples to bananas.  Deer Grove Preserve is in Palatine, but I don't feel that being located in a suburb detracts from the beauty. I did visit on a weekday (post Labor Day), so I imagine that you'd hear more activity when visiting on a weekend -- I was the only tent-camper on site!
This is a perfect place for a Microadventure!

First time ever camping and my experience was amazing. This location is great, quiet, safe and has bathrooms and showers. the rangers and volunteers are beyond friendly. The other campers are also very kind. The wildlife and nature were so great to witness. If you've never been camping like me, this is a great first  step!

chesterton-in-indiana-dunes-state-park.editorialSummary: Dune-lined park for hiking, swimming, fishing, cross-country skiing, birding & more, plus campsites.

reviewSummary.text: A beautiful hidden gem in Indiana. This was our first time here, and I'm glad we made the trip. Who knew you could drive 4 hours, and be at a beach in Indiana! The trails, and campground were very nice. The trails were great, and peaceful. I wish they were marked a little better. BE WARNED the mosquitoes here are crazy on the trails so come extra prepared for that! I had many bites especially on my feet. I will definitely come better prepared for next time. The trails were beautiful, and well maintained. The beach was beautiful, and clean. The bathrooms at the beach were very dirty is my only complaint. Great for some nighttime photography as well! Overall we can't wait to come back and visit!

I LOVE PATOKA LAKE!! The lake is so beautiful!! The campground is very well maintained. The camp hosts are always so friendly and nice. The staff also.
If I got only one vacation week a year, I‚Äôd spend it here!! The wildlife is so pretty to watch.
Feeding the fish at the marina is my granddaughter‚Äôs favorite thing.

fort-wayne-in-johnny-appleseed-campgroun.editorialSummary: River access, campground, playground, basketball court & Johnny Appleseed's grave in a 31-acre park.

reviewSummary.text: Johnny Appleseed Campground is a hidden gem, perfectly situated in the heart of town with easy access to grocery stores, malls, restaurants, and all the amenities you might need. While it doesn't offer sewer hookups, the campground provides a convenient dump station and a pump truck service for just $10. The campground hosts, Marcia and Brenda, are incredibly friendly and always willing to lend a helping hand. Although the campground isn't massive, its shaded grounds and comfortable layout make it a great spot to relax and unwind. Highly recommend!

north-liberty-in-potato-creek-state-park.editorialSummary: Multi-use trails, lake boating & fishing, public archaeological sites & more, plus campgrounds.

reviewSummary.text:
Great campground. Sites a spaced well, plenty of room. Quiet. Very nice paved bike trail. Beautiful lake. Best water fill and separate dumping stations I've ever seen.
They are currently building a new inn on the lake.
We will definitely be back.

My family and I absolutely love this park, it‚Äôs been a favorite of our for a long time. We just recently had our first group gathering last week and had a wonderful time. We enjoyed a beautiful meditation and nature walk in the Wetlands side of the park. I highly recommend.

Very nice people took it over recently and are turning it around. It‚Äôs already very well maintained and the problems that apparently used to plague it are cleaned out. Very easy access, sites are well spaced, level, and clean. Water and electric at (nearly?) all. I had 30amps and assume all are at least that. Biggest of rigs would have no problem getting in. Some pull through, most back in, but very large. Very nice fields, trails, and playground for kids. Great location right on the river. Bathroom and shower house is very clean and nice. Dump station included and has full rinse hose. The city still manages the website and fails completely. Prices are $23-$25 night. Do call before going, or at least before parking, because they do take phone reservations but don‚Äôt publish that online or indicate reserved sites. Highly recommend for a quick overnight, or longer. Cute town a short walk away with a great ice cream shop and much more
Nice small state park. Scenic campground right on the river. Modern bathhouse with hot showers. Has a newer playground boat ramp and awesome bike trails.

Nice clean campground with big sites and a playground. Plenty of hiking trails and raccon river bike trail less than a mile away. Would have gotten 5 stars if they had a dump station for black and grey water.

We camped in a 5th wheel. The campground was clean. The folks in the office super helpful and friendly. The two bath houses were sufficient for anything you needed however, I did not use them. One in our group did and felt like everything was adequate. A beautiful river flowing through. Tons of walking and biking paths. And lots to do in town. My only complaint is the noise off Highway 52, but not much they can do about that!

Bob Shetler Campground is a peaceful and well-kept spot near the Saylorville Dam. The sites are clean, spacious, and easy to access. I love that it‚Äôs right by the dam where I used to catch some giant fish ‚Äî perfect for anyone who enjoys fishing and relaxing by the water. A great place to unwind close to the city
Beautiful lake. Nice facilities. Large old trees providing shade ‚ù§Ô∏è
Great place to camp. About 15 minutes outside of Pella and easy to get to. Sites are very spacious. Great walking/biking path. Fishing looks good but we didn't have the opportunity to actually do it.

This campground is well maintained with very nice hosts.  Firewood is available on-site at a self serve station.  The bathrooms are clean and conveniently located.  Wallashuck is located in close proximity to the town of Pella which offers a lot of small town charm!

waterloo-ia-george-wyth-state-park.editorialSummary: Multiple lakes for boating, fishing & windsurfing plus multi-use woodland trails, campsites & more.

reviewSummary.text:
I am a ham operator and did an activation at this park. Loved the lakes and the bathrooms were clean.

A super cute state park and they also offer camping and have a boat dock for the boats for fishing.

We made it here on a Monday and set up. Not sure but only 3 rv sites appear available.  Donations are at the restroom buildings. Five days is the limit but we are overnighter. Appreeciate the lovely shade and amenities.

Here is a polished and clean version of your review:
Peaceful and Very Clean for an Overnight Stay
We stayed here for just one night while driving through, and I found the campground to be excellent. Based on our experience in October, it was very clean and wonderfully peaceful. The overall vibe felt both safe and relaxing, whether you're traveling alone or with a family.
The campground is set in a beautiful location, surrounded by equestrian farms. I really appreciated the wide spaces between each site and the many mature trees that provide shade and privacy. Many of the sites also feature a concrete pad, which is a nice bonus. We only needed an electric hookup for our short stay, and everything was working perfectly. If you choose a grass site the cost is $30 per night vs $40 for the concrete pad site.
As a fairly picky and clean traveler, I found the facilities to be in great condition. Yes, the bathroom and shower building may be a little dated, but they were exceptionally clean, which is what matters most.
For families, the amenities look good; they have a nice playground, tennis court, volleyball court, and basketball court.
I would absolutely choose to stay here again in the future.

One of the nicest Federal campgrounds we have stayed at so far.   The campsites have a good amount of space between them and overall it was quiet at night. The bathrooms were cleaned daily even during the shutdown. The sites are open to the sky with almost no branches overhead.  It's a nice spot for star gazing. We were here in October and we started to hear the fishing boats leaving the harbor around 5am. We enjoyed using the free shuttle to explore the hiking trails on the peninsula. The bike trails were challenging with loose pea stone gravel but scenic and fun.

bourne-ma-bourne-scenic-park.editorialSummary: Bucolic park by the Cape Cod Canal with camping, fishing, hiking & other activities.

reviewSummary.text:
If your a resident you can visit the park and enjoy the amenities.
My kids love the jumping pillow.
The pools are well kept and warm.
There is only a few tent sites but reasonably priced.
We really didnt need a golf cart as the park isn't huge, but
In did come in handy exp a night getting the little ones to the bathroom in a jiffy.

sagamore-ma-scusset-beach-state-reservat.editorialSummary: A 1.5 mile stretch along the Cape Cod Canal with camping, fishing pier, swimming areas & bike paths.

reviewSummary.text: A nice place for a morning walk. Especially after season.  A beautiful estuary environment exists  a short distance  south.  Not a swimming beach, cold water, rocky shore and very crowded in season, but bliss when everyone goes home!

salem-ma-winter-island-park.editorialSummary: Marine recreational park with seasonal RV & tent camping, a boat launch, lighthouse & historic fort.

reviewSummary.text: In my opinion, this is the best way to stay in Salem. A tent site is 38 a night. If you book far enough in advance you can stay close enough to the beach you will hear the waves while you sleep. As afar as the physical grounds, its okay, nothing special, its the location that makes it next level. The island is little and easy to.get around. If you have bikes, this is a perfect adventure for anyone wanting to be close enough to all the Salem action in October without the price tag. We walked everywhere. Its totally reasonbly walkable if you are a person who enjoys walking. There are ubers as well and for the most part ubers are cheaper than the parking in the center of town. You could always uber into the center and walk around there and uber back. It was $12 one way when I did it. Parking was 50. There is some sort of power station that does make some noise and planes regularly go overhead. As you walk around the little island you will hear these. It did not bother my ability to sleep. I will add video and photos to this review later today.

My stay was short but very pleasant! The campground seems to be a popular spot for fishers. It's well shaded, with clean bathrooms, a dump station, and firewood and ice for sale. The hosts even have a little cafe that's open in the morning where they do coffee and breakfast. There's a trail right by the entrance that makes it super easy to hop on for running, biking, or walking. It's 3 miles (or so) from the cute town of Frankfort which has lovely shops and a nice clean beach. Have already recommended this place to my parents üòÄ.

grand-haven-mi-grand-haven-state-park.editorialSummary: Sandy beach area on 48 acres with swimming, sunbathing, scenic views, a fishing pier & a lighthouse.

reviewSummary.text: Love this state park, so cool being able to camp right on the beach and the water! The spots are very tight though so keep that in mind, it took me a couple tries to get in the spot and I usually never have a problem with backing up my camper. I could barely fit my camper and truck in my spot, but once you get over how tight it is, it is a beautiful place. I will say be careful getting a site next to the bathrooms by the river, they do not turn off the outside lights and they are super bright at night, no problem for us in a camper we could just close the blinds but a tent would be rough.

petoskey-mi-petoskey-state-park.editorialSummary: State park offers camping, a mile-long bayside beach plus diverse woodland hiking trails.

reviewSummary.text: This place is gorgeous! A must see for anyone, in or out of State.  A truly 1 of a kind place, & if you know, you know. If not, you'll have to FAFO so to say. ü§£ Northern Michigan has many treasures, but Petoskey has the Petoskey Stone. You have to visit to get 1, because you can only get them here.

This little park was a great stay. We contacted the host in the morning to see if we could stay the night. I asked them if they could save us a site and we would be coming in late. She had no problem with coming in at 11pm. She was waiting for us and helped us into one of there 15 sites. We plan on staying again and maybe a little longer than 8 hrs. There's a few trails to walk and a nice playground for the kids.

rogers-city-mi-hoeft-state-park.editorialSummary: Forested park includes hiking, biking & skiing terrain, plus 1 mile of shoreline along Lake Huron.

reviewSummary.text: This is a really beautiful and well cared for park.  Vault Toilets for Day Use visitors are very clean and well kept.  The trails are beautiful for birding, and hiking and one takes you to a stream if you are in to rock hounding.  The beach access offers many ways to get access.  There is a wooden path that is easiest but there are also many dunes paths for those that want more of a fun challenge.  A few mosquitoes and a few flies for this time of year is expected, but not awful.

south-haven-mi-van-buren-state-park.editorialSummary: Park with lakeside sand dunes & woodland trails features picnic area with grills & modern campsites.

reviewSummary.text: Beautiful little area off the lake with plenty of short hike trails leading to the beach. It was raining off and on during my visit but a beautiful view anyway! Definitely hope to go back and spend some more time hiking and hanging out on the beach. (There are some beautiful rocks for anyone who collects. The sand embeds some glass looking pieces that makes some of the sedimentary rocks looks metallic. Stunning what nature can do!) Only took a star off because it was hard to navigate and find the trail heads. Could use some more signs.

traverse-city-mi-traverse-city-state-par.editorialSummary: Bustling urban park open for camping year-round offers heated restrooms, biking trails & a beach.

reviewSummary.text: We have stayed at the State Park Campground about 6x‚Äôs. We love it there. It is a long drive or we would go more often. A large state park campground with different size lots. There is a bridge that goes to the public beach area. A bike trail behind campground that provides access to stores and restaurants. It‚Äôs clean and well kept.

My sister booked a tenting site here a few days ago. We really loved it. Had the most amazing sunset ever over the lake. We were watching it while playing cards and eating dinner. Clean showers, bathrooms and check in was easy. Thanks for having us!

bemidji-mn-lake-bemidji-state-park.editorialSummary: This park with diverse wildlife offers camping, hiking, fishing, picnicking & cross-country skiing.

reviewSummary.text: Had a fun 4 days despite the June 21 2025 storm. The staff was great helping out folks after the storm had passed. While some things were unavailable there was still plenty to do and we enjoyed our campsite. It is definitely a place worth visiting and the camping area is very nice. The shower and restroom area is centered in the campground.  Well lit at night so easy to find. There are also vault toilets available and are closer for some sites.  Lots of water points so filling up is very easy from your site in most cases. Will definitely return and highly recommend a visit when in the area or as a vacation destination.

brainerd-mn-crow-wing-state-park.editorialSummary: Riverfront preserve including campgrounds, canoeing, forested trails & a historic village site.

reviewSummary.text: Nice state park. Lots of hiking trails from campground. You can fish the Mississippi River from campsites. Bike trail was great, 7.5 miles to Baxter trail all paved and follows along river in the trees. Not much for kids to do with no playground observed. Electric sites are to close together with no privacy but non electric were separated by trees/shrubs. Bathrooms are older but were clean.

carolton-mn-jay-cooke-state-park.editorialSummary: Park with a suspension bridge & a historic cemetery offering camping, hiking & cross-country skiing.

reviewSummary.text:
I live in a place that doesn‚Äôt have fall foliage so I took a trip to MN and WI in October. This park was my first stop after leaving the airport.

I loved it so much! The colors were beautiful, the weather was perfect, and the hiking trails were a great way to spend the afternoon. If I‚Äôm in the area again I‚Äôll definitely be back!

centerville-mn-rice-creek-chain-of-lakes.editorialSummary: 5,500-acre park with a boat dock, campsites, hiking & biking trails, a fishing pier & playgrounds.

reviewSummary.text: This is a great campground and so close to the Twin Cities. We have stayed in two different non-electric tent sites. Both were nice and had some privacy. I appreciate that they allow one night reservations, including on the weekend, instead of requiring two nights like every other campground.  We stay here on our way up North. My only suggestion is about safety in the shower room. Locking doors on the shower stalls in place of the frosted white, slightly see thru shower curtains would feel safer. Everything else is great!

Lovely quiet campground, clean and well maintained. I almost gave 5 stars, the only issue is that it's not super big-rig friendly (it's not impossible,  just some of the sites have trees too close to the campsites, you'll see a lot of them have bumper-height scars, especially at the edge by the road, we didn't hit ours but it took us about 5 tries to back in playing dodg'em with the trees and had to go in crooked so our slideout wouldnt hit a shrubby tree). If you have a smaller camper you probably wouldn't have a problem, and there are several sites we noted would be easier for future visits (I hesitate to write them here since it could make them harder to get... 7, 11, 17, 25, and then 22 is the only pull-through).  Also, if you come in from East Gull Lake Drive, there is a point right before you get to the recreation area where you think "this can't be right, I must have messed up!" (because the road gets narrow and looks like it's just going to some private cottages and there will be nowhere to turn around) and then there's a narrow one-lane bridge.  I really recommend coming in on Gull Lake Dam Rd if it works for your route at all.
Another review mentioned how diligent the rangers are about quiet hours, the reviewer was writing it as a criticism but I read that and thought "that sounds perfect!".  We did find it to be totally quiet after 10pm, if anyone who has anything to do with running this campground ever reads this, please keep up the good work!!  We also observed that the volunteer hosts were extremely on top of cleaning up sites after people left.
For activities, there is a playground, fishing near the dam (with a fish cleaning station), a place to put in canoes/kayaks and the park rangers hosted a few activities like nature bingo and a hike.  We were in the area for a family reunion, so we didn't participate in them but it was nice they had them and also that they told us about them when they checked us in.  There is also a day-use area of the park, which we didn't visit, but according to the pamphlet it has a boat ramp, swimming beach, another playground, picnic area, volleyball, basketball and horseshoes.
In the campground is a clean shower house with flush toilets and then vault toilets in 2 smaller buildings that were not stinky.  There are several water bottle fillers, which I've never seen in a campground before and we did take advantage of them.
We would definitely stay here again if we were in the area!
Tennis courts near here are always fun to play at. They do have a lot of weeds and are not very well kept however!

luverne-mn-blue-mounds-state-park.editorialSummary: A 100-foot Sioux quartzite cliff & bison herd draw hikers, climbers & campers to this sizable park.

reviewSummary.text:
Blue Mounds state park is a great park in the middle of a seemingly unremarkable part of the state. One of the hikes across the prairie is hot and unshaded, so bring lots of water and dress lightly in the Summer months!
The bur oak trail on the South side of the park is beautiful and there are even some giant boulders to climb on, too!
There's relatively few trails/things to explore at this park, so savor the things you do here.
We had gorgeous fall days for camping! The campground is beautifully maintained and the bathrooms are wonderful.

soudan-mn-lake-vermilion-sudan-undergrou.editorialSummary: Home to the state's oldest iron ore mine, this park offers tours, trails & picnic areas.

reviewSummary.text: I just did the surface tour with Maddie and it was excellent!!  I thought I‚Äôd be disappointed since the underground tour was cancelled but having a guide for the surface tour made up for it. She was had so much knowledge of the mining industry and process. It‚Äôs hard to believe they don‚Äôt offer an above ground tour normally I feel like it would be hard to truly understand the rest of the process just walking around the other buildings.

photos.attribution: Lake Vermilion-Soudan Underground Mine State Park

reviewSummary.text: It's camping no need for any other explanation. First trip of year.

two-harbors-mn-split-rock-lighthouse-sta.editorialSummary: Known for its historic lighthouse, this park boasts trails, lakefront campsites & a rocky beach.

reviewSummary.text: This was a bucket list stop for me and the main motivation for our trip to the area, it did not disappoint! We purchased tickets ahead of time for the Keeper‚Äôs tour because I thought I read that it was a max of 10 per tour and I wanted to make sure we got in, however it seemed that if there was a bigger group they split the tours between guides for a max of 10 per group. Paid entry into the park is not required if you‚Äôre there for the tour. We arrived at 8:30 for the 9:00 tour - the building does not open until 10:00, so don‚Äôt expect to walk up and go in. However, our tour guide came out to greet us when she noticed people arriving and unlocked the door for us to use the bathroom before the tour, so that was appreciated. Amy was our tour guide and she was a delight to spend time with, obviously very knowledgeable and passionate about what she does and encouraged everyone to take their time for photos and gawking. The area is currently under construction so you will see some fencing and obvious construction work right now but I was still able to get great photos. Unfortunately it was smoggy from the wildfires so I didn‚Äôt get great shots from the iconic lighthouse viewing areas, but nothing anyone can do about that. I recommend wearing walking shoes as the paths are rocky and there are some stairs throughout the tour, obviously to go up to the lighthouse. The path to the iconic viewing spots out on the trails (separate from the tour but still required paid entry) is all dirt and gravel and there are SEVERAL stairs (long stair case) - we went down the stairs and took the dirt path back around to avoid going back up. The gift shop was the type I was comfortable spending money at, it is set up well and not full of junk. I also recommend walking through the building and watching the video about the lighthouse. Pay for the tour, you won‚Äôt be disappointed!

We‚Äôve camped at Sakatah Lake State Park several times over the years, and it continues to be a great place to camp in southern Minnesota. The campsites are well-maintained and nicely spaced, the restrooms are clean, and the park itself is awesome.

Wildlife viewing is always a highlight‚Äîbut like many other places, mosquitoes can be a factor. Be mindful of the season and recent weather. In a wetter year, the mosquitoes can be intense! So far in 2025, they haven‚Äôt been nearly as bad compared to previous visits. Still, packing bug spray is always a smart move.

Overall, it‚Äôs a great place to relax, hike, bike the Sakatah Trail, and enjoy nature. Highly recommended!

The campground was really nice. We were there on the weekend that they had the Halloween decorating contest. We ran to the store and bought a bunch of stuff to decorate, only for them not to do the contest. We asked about it and they said they would post the winner on their page the next day. They did not post it so I called and the gentleman said he would find out and get back to me well that has been 2 weeks. Such a bummer.

Great fishing in this lake. No problems catching plenty of bass! The locals are friendly and willing to share fishing knowledge (to an extent) The camp ground is nice and the lake manager is availible on a regular basis. Nice walking or biking trail. Nature trail beside the campgroud is accessible but grown over slightly.

lawson-mo-watkins-mill-state-park.editorialSummary: Campground & 100-acre lake featuring a textile mill & living-history farm, plus a biking path.

reviewSummary.text: We love this place!!! Awesome spot in a perfect location - close to a nice town with lots of great stuff, including a Natural Grocers! The campsite hosts are very nice and super accommodating!!! We are very happy with our overall experience and can‚Äôt wait to come back!!!

Best camping along the Katy Trail hands down.  Whether you are hiking, biking, horse riding, or RVing, this is the place for you.  Wide open space,  lots of shady spots,  great location,  showers,  laundry, and quiet! So many places along the Katy are very loud.  Here you can hear yourself think and hear the birds sing.  Great place especially heading westbound cross county.  Also very dog friendly and very very good value.  Thanks Kelly for going above and beyond in helping me with my bike issue!

Beautiful area, very nice camping spots. It was very peaceful, except for the mowers. We camped during the week, and the mowing must be done, so I really can't complain. Restrooms were clean and well-maintained. We'd definitely camp here again!

weston-mo-weston-bend-state-park.editorialSummary: This park with a campground offers paved & unpaved trails & overlook views of the Missouri River.

reviewSummary.text: A hidden gem just a short drive from Fort Leavenworth...Weston Bend State Park is absolutely beautiful. The drive-through roads wind through peaceful forest and open fields with some of the best river views in the area. The overlook platform gives you a sweeping look at the Missouri River, and the trails are easy to follow and well-maintained. My favorite part was the restored tobacco barn museum ‚Äî such a unique glimpse into local history and early agriculture. It‚Äôs the perfect mix of nature and heritage. Whether you‚Äôre hiking, picnicking, or just taking a scenic drive, this park is a must-see.

norfolk-ne-ta-ha-zouka-park.editorialSummary: Park offering facilities for softball, sand volleyball, horseshoes & disc golf, plus a playground.

reviewSummary.text: They have done a lot of work here over the last few years and this park is absolutely gorgeous! Including a nice playground and free splash park, as well as river front trail and seating areas and great shelters for picnics.

Clean quiet park with spacious electric only spots.  Fill up freshwater before you park, dump as you leave.  Only $20 a night!  Didn‚Äôt give it five stars because we like having full hook ups and pull thru spots, but it is a great campground for the price!

We had a great time at Gotta Get Away Campground. We stayed towards the later side of August (1 night) on our camping trip out  to South Dakota. It was quiet, only seasonal campers were there at the time. Staff was great, it was kid and dog friendly. The pool is huge and it was super warm. There is an awesome Arcade and nice clean laundry facilities and restrooms w/ shower. On our way back through we stayed on labor day weekend. The place was packed! I think we might have gotten the last site available. There were kids, pets, golf carts. It was really lively and there were tons of activities to do with my kids. They also had food trucks while we were there, there was a pizza truck and donut truck during our stay- both were great and it was a nice treat. We had a great time at this campground- it was clean, well managed, easily accessible to the highway and fairly priced! We will definitely be back again!

Absolutely immaculate and gorgeous state park on Lake Eerie.
Spacious campsites, extremely spacious, and beautiful views, every campsite we walked by was private and comfortable.
People are friendly.
Campsites are very clean
Trails are gorgeous.
Water and bathe is close by and the bathroom is very clean.
Beautiful birds throughout the campground, extremely enjoyable.
We feel extremely blessed that we got to stay here for a night.

springfield-oh-buck-creek-state-park.editorialSummary: Rolling hills with hiking & bridle trails, a lake for fishing & boating, plus campsites & cottages.

reviewSummary.text:
We stayed at the group campground. It has a bathroom for men and women. It does not have showers or an electrical receptacle inside the building. It has several fire rings and picnic tables, a paved parking lot with multiple places to park. The marina is down the road. Signs for the park are not well established. However, each entrance is down in back. The campground side of the park has multiple side road loops and offshoots down to the water, archery, marina, beach or disc golf areas.
The Buck Creek trail is closed 2 miles from the head of the trail. The is a bridge is out. Also, at the bottom of the dam it is quite smelly from the effluent being released.
We would definitely do another stay. It was an enjoyable place with lots of activities over the first weekend of October for Halloween.
Good place to camp. For a fair ground. Attended a bluegrass festival. Had a ball.

nehalem-or-nehalem-bay-state-park.editorialSummary: 890-acre oceanfront park with hiking, biking & equestrian trails, campsites, yurts & an airstrip.

reviewSummary.text: I'm camping with a popup trailer at the comfortable, and beautiful Nahalem State Park Campground. Spacious campsites with loads of green level space for tents or for hanging out. Dogs allowed on leash and off-leash at the beach. Thoughtfully set up with places to deposit dog bags and get additional ones as you're walking through. There's a brand new and especially nice bathroom building near my site (D43). Some sites are shaded (which also protects you from the wind on windy days). Both bathroom and shower buildings were clean and well kept. It feels really nice here, and while you have to climb over what amounts to a large sand dune to get to the beach - what a lovely beach it is. This park is far enough from 101 to be very quiet. Prices are much more reasonable than private RV parks. I enjoyed the new looking water and electric hookups (50A, 20A, 110V). There are warm lights that come on by the hookups at dark and add a bit of charm.

Nice park with a shaded trail system, marina, and small store. The trails offer a peaceful walk, though they were a bit messy‚Äîcovered in leaves and branches. Some areas feel dated, with old equipment stations left behind and picnic tables that are worn but still usable. It‚Äôs an average park with decent lake access, but for a paid day-use area, I expected a little more upkeep and care.

We had an amazing stay at this campground! The sites were spacious, clean, and well-organized‚Äîeverything felt thoughtfully maintained. The restrooms were spotless, which made a huge difference in comfort during our visit. What really stood out was the team of caretakers‚Äîfriendly, attentive, and always ready to help with anything we needed. Their service made us feel truly welcomed. Overall, it was a fantastic experience and we‚Äôre already looking forward to coming back. Highly recommend!

Chris and Lunda, camp hosts, helped me out when I couldn't get internet and I met some fun people who shared info about where I was going. The morning sun rise over the mts. And through the fog was lovely. I enjoyed the flock of geese call out and flying low following the river. Enjoyable night. I'd go back.

dunbar-pa-ohiopyle-state-park.editorialSummary: Gateway to the Laurel Highlands offers 20,500 acres of hiking, whitewater boating & picnicking.

reviewSummary.text: Beautiful area for a hike or just to take in the majestic views of the area waterfall. My wife and I went here to hike an easier trail as part of a small weekend away, and it was a lovely time taking in all the nature. The trails were well marked and explained, and we enjoyed that though our trail wasn't an "easy" hike, it was very doable and there were options throughout to divert off onto other paths. The area is also nice, housing a number of restaurants and shops. Worth the stop if in the Ohiopyle area.

We got one of the new sites along the water with a spectacular view. There isn‚Äôt a better site to see the sunset. This place is the quietest campground we‚Äôve stayed at. Not many people out at all. The check in was easy as the host family saw us and checked us in. The bathrooms are clean and spacious. Sites are spacious and clean also. You don‚Äôt feel like you‚Äôre on top of the site next to you. Most people here are in bigger RVs and fifth wheels is we assume they stay inside.

The only negatives we had is there is never anyone at the camp office so firewood is nearly impossible to get so I recommend bringing your own. The sites on the water are along the waking path with a fence dividing them. It‚Äôs fine, but just know the public and fisherman walk here and talk all day and night until 9pm when it‚Äôs locked. It‚Äôs not too crowded,  but they‚Äôre here. Also, no one monitors the front gate so anyone can come in. While eating dinner 2 teens rode their motorcycles in her with loud music and did a loop then left. There isn‚Äôt anything for kids or recreation on the campground so be prepared if they‚Äôre used to a playground or something. None of these are deal breakers to me, it‚Äôs such a great place. Other than that, you can‚Äôt find a better place.

Awesome campground on the Cumberland River. Loved staying here.. even the inside sites (not waterfront) are amazing. Listening to the pecans fall when the wind blows.. and the HUGE barges passing by are my favorite things about being here.

lawrenceburg-tn-david-crockett-state-par.editorialSummary: Creekside park with walking trails, camping & cabins, plus boat rentals & a massive swimming pool.

reviewSummary.text: Favorite Tennessee State Park. We go every year at least once a year. There are two camps grounds one by a creek and one in the mountain. Facilities are clean. They have site for Large RV‚Äôs to tent camping. There is a small museum, small inclosure for some Owls and raptors. Take your bike lots of trails for biking and hiking!

winchester-tn-tims-ford-state-park.editorialSummary: Lakeside park offering a marina with boat rentals, fishing, a golf course, cabins & camping.

reviewSummary.text: Absolutely beautiful! Stayed in one of the cabins, and I loved every second of it. The cabin was a clean and spacious living area. The cabin has a large private porch to the master bedroom and a very large extended porch for the guest room and the dining area, all with outstanding views.  The trails in this park are beautiful and generally easy to hike with scenic views of the waterway and forests. The visitors center is wonderful and full of information. They have critters found in the area that are being rehabilitated, such as a hawk , a great horned owl, snakes, and others around for viewing. The rangers are knowledge and outgoing, providing great experiences to kids. We were able to hold a snake, rock climb, and get a nice tour before we wandered off to hit the trails. I recommend bringing the family and enjoying time outdoors. ALSO, apprently, this is Sasquatch country lol, so be on the lookout out. HAVE FUN!!!

mineral-wells-tx-lake-mineral-wells-stat.editorialSummary: Scenic area featuring trails to town, camping areas & mineral-rich waters for swimming.

reviewSummary.text:
Late Post | Winter Season

Stayed in a campsite back in January in our camper van. Such a great Texas State Park! Well maintained and the bathrooms were clean. Did a couple of trails and even saw an armadillo!

Also, love that they have a little free library where you can take/leave a book! Next time we camp there, I‚Äôll definitely bring some books to leave.

needville-tx-brazos-bend-state-park.editorialSummary: Home of an observatory, lakes & fishing, plus hiking/biking trails, camping & lots of alligators.

reviewSummary.text:
Absolutely beautiful park and a great escape from the city!
Brazos Bend State Park is one of the best parks I‚Äôve visited in Texas. The trails are peaceful, clean, and surrounded by nature, you can see tons of birds, deer, and even a few alligators from a safe distance. The park is very well-maintained, and the staff are friendly and helpful.

Perfect for hiking, biking, or just relaxing by the water. I loved how easy it was to spot wildlife without feeling unsafe, and the camping areas are clean and quiet with plenty of space. If you go, bring a camera and some bug spray, and visit early in the morning or near sunset for the best experience.

Highly recommend for families, nature lovers, or anyone who just wants to disconnect and enjoy a bit of peace in the outdoors.

valley-view-tx-johnson-branch.editorialSummary: Section of lake state park with easy to challenging hiking & biking trail loops & picnic sites.

reviewSummary.text: We had such a great time at this state park. Very friendly and helpful rangers, clean and fun park. We stayed over the weekend in our RV (site 71) and had a great time. Most folks settled down after the sun dropped. Campers were helpful and friendly. This was our first time camping in our new RV and I think we are spoiled. Love this park! We can't wait to come back.

chehalis-wa-rainbow-falls-state-park.editorialSummary: 139-acre camping park on the Skagit River with a waterfall, a fuchsia garden, trails & swimming.

reviewSummary.text: High marks for beauty, historic locale. No visual privacy at camp sites. A couple nice walks available without having to drive to the other side of the river. Very shady. For early season camping that made it chillier than expected and lots of low-hanging smoke on cloudy day. Restrooms a little underwhelming. 47 camping spots and a group camp going on - the little buildings got a heavy workout. Like all Washington state parks, a Discover pass is required. People were courteous. I enjoyed a walking tour of Chehalis before driving to this park.

We were looking for a reasonable priced place for a quick trip in our toy hauler. We had some long overdue maintenance work we needed to get done so we were not looking for anything fancy. This place was perfect. It is easy to get to from downtown Cle Elum and has a lot of spots to choose from. We came midweek so reserving a spot was no problem a couple of days out. The spots themselves range from open grass to nestled in the trees. Our spot was grass but next time we will try to get something in the trees. When we went to the office, the gal at the desk was super friendly and helpful. She gave us insider tips on the best spots to stay next time we come back.

I am knocking off one star due to the constant freeway noise. The property butts up to I-90 so the noise never dies down. It's not really the campgrounds fault but it is something to be aware of if you are sensitive to noise while trying to sleep. I think the sites in the trees would be better but we were not there so I can't say for sure. Our site also took a bit of side to side leveling but that is part of camping.

If the freeway noise doesn't bother you, it is a great, affordable, and close to town campground. We will definitely come again.

blue-mounds-wi-blue-mound-state-park.editorialSummary: A swimming pool, plus hiking, biking & cross-country skiing trails & a campground in a hilltop park.

reviewSummary.text:
This park offers a lot!

Hiking trails, playground, two towers with great views and an additional viewing area with a unique winding walkway, a very nice swimming pool, mountain biking trail, rocks, flowers, and wildlife. This place has it all!

There is a lot of parking here in several areas. Quite a few restrooms. Lots of tables and grills. Several shelters. This is a great place to spend a day or a weekend.

Can't go wrong visiting here, I highly recommend it!

Be sure to check out Cave of the Mounds when in the area, especially if you've never been. It's an incredibly unique experience, and one of my favorite places in the state!

cornell-wi-brunet-island-state-park.editorialSummary: 1,300-acre park on the Chippewa & Fisher rivers, offering camping, fishing, boating & hiking trails.

reviewSummary.text: Took advantage of warmer temps to log some IAT miles.  Nice to have access to electric to heat my little camper...not to mention, no crowds!  I'm sure that isn't the case during the peak months!!  Great opportunity to get a photo of the Milky Way!  Close to town for easy access to Cornell businesses and fairly close access to IAT segments in the area!

fish-creek-wi-peninsula-state-park.editorialSummary: Huge scenic park with a 38-acre island, 18-hole golf course, bike trails, camping & more.

reviewSummary.text: 8/21/25 - this park is absolutely gorgeous! Definitely a MUST STOP and easily a reason to visit Door County all on its own. This was our favorite stop of the entire trip!!! Lots of bikers enjoying the shady roads and trails. The views are spectacular and Eagle Tower is such a unique structure, with a fantastic view and picture opportunities. Numerous picnic and camping areas to be enjoyed. Lots of water all around to enjoy as well. Very scenic and so much to do!

trempealeau-wi-perrot-state-park.editorialSummary: Scenic park featuring hiking trails over bluffs with river views plus camping & picnic areas.

reviewSummary.text: I love this place some of the best and most scenic hiking trails in the wisconsin state park system that I found so far. Just be aware that these trails have a lot of elevation gain and drop and can be considered challenging to some people. But if you can brave the hike, the views are stunning. I would highly recommend.

two-rivers-wi-point-beach-state-forest-c.editorialSummary: 3,000-acre recreational park on Lake Michigan with forests, sandy beaches & a historic lighthouse.

reviewSummary.text: We camped for 4 nights over a long weekend.   The sites are nice with many having electric hookups.  Many of the sites have quite a bit of privacy.  They do have several buddy sites.  The bike trail was a beautiful peaceful ride.  Bummer, there are no tours of the lighthouse.  The beach is beautiful and a wonderful walk option.  It was great to be able to get ice cream and breakfast at the lodge on the weekend.

We have been going to Tunnel Trail every year for the last 6 years. We‚Äôve stayed in the cabins and in our own tents. I love that the trail is right off the campground - super easy to get to. The people are very nice in the office too. We love the heated pool - a great way to cool off after a morning bike ride with the kiddos. Only thing we wish would change is the main bathrooms haven‚Äôt had working showers for three years. There are additional showers on the grounds but if it‚Äôs busy we end up waiting to take a shower. We just went this past weekend and the campground is looking great - trees are trimmed and people are working hard to make it nice despite the owner‚Äôs husband passing away unexpectedly this past year.  Campsites are spacious, the store is stocked with any supplies you might forget and you can get your bike pass right in the office before hitting the trails. We‚Äôll be back every year!

tucson-az-rincon-country-west-rv-resort.editorialSummary: Sociable RV resort with a pool, ball courts, gym, library, craft rooms, dog park & putting green.

reviewSummary.text: This was our second visit. Really enjoyed our stay. Great location. Desert so mostly gravel. Good sized dog park but also a lot of places to walk a dog - just make sure your dog will go in gravel. Residents in the area all very nice. It is in the flight path of the airport and fighter jets practice overhead but I loved that. Did not use their facilities but they looked nice. Even had a dog bath station.

gatlinburg-tn-greenbrier-campground.editorialSummary: Scenic, riverside RV/tent campsites & rustic cabins, plus a general store & recreational activities.

reviewSummary.text:
‚∏ª

Site 16 (Premium Riverfront)

We just stayed here and wanted to share an honest review for fellow RVers.

Pros:
‚Ä¢	The campground itself is very well taken care of ‚Äî clean, landscaped, and decorated really cute for fall, which gave it a welcoming feel.
‚Ä¢	Staff were friendly and helpful, always quick with a smile.
‚Ä¢	The surrounding area is great, lots to see and do nearby.

Cons (specific to our stay at Site 16):
‚Ä¢	We booked a premium riverfront site, but the spacing left a lot to be desired. Our spot was right on top of our neighbors ‚Äî so much so that we couldn‚Äôt comfortably open our door or blinds without feeling like we were staring into their camp, and vice versa. Definitely no privacy.
‚Ä¢	We noticed dog feces in multiple areas of the campground that hadn‚Äôt been picked up, which was disappointing.
‚Ä¢	A few trailers down, campers were smoking, and because the sites are so close together the smell drifted right to us. Not pleasant at all.

Overall:
It‚Äôs a nicely maintained campground with friendly staff and a cute atmosphere, but if you‚Äôre looking for space and privacy, I‚Äôd be cautious about booking the premium riverfront sites ‚Äî especially Site 16. Hopefully management can address the spacing and cleanliness issues, because with a few changes this could be an outstanding place to stay.

Nice park,level sites with gravel base. Porta potty instead of real bathrooms. No laundry at this time but the 24 hr coin laundry is about 4 miles away. Price is reasonable monthly. Propane fill on site at the camper dealership. Confluence Tower is right next door so pretty easy to find the park.

This KOA is one of the nicest I have visited.  Although located in Tucson, it has a relaxed, tranquil, environment that makes one think they are not in the city.  It is convenient to most of the popular tourist attractions in Tucson, including the Pima Air Museum, Saquaro NP, and Mission San Xavier del Bac.  Sites are level, long and wide, with fruit trees providing separation between the sites so you don't feel jammed in with your neighbor.  If you are visiting in hot weather, they offer solar panel shaded sites that provide shade to the entire site and your rig, enabling you to actually enjoy sitting outside without broiling.

There are two pools and a hot tub onsite, putting greens on the end of almost every row, a restaurant, and many other amenities.

Check in is easy, the staff is friendly and attentive.  We will definitely be returning.
Lots of trees and brush have been thinned out. So not as lush as it was when I went there years ago

mammoth-lakes-ca-mammoth-mountain-rv-par.editorialSummary: Wooded campground offering RV & tent sites, plus cabins, an indoor pool, laundry & restrooms.

reviewSummary.text: Good luck getting a reservation. It's a popular park. The staff is friendly, the location is good, if you can get a spot away from the road. Easy access to trails. Showers a bit messy. The price is a little on the high side, but it's a resort town.

newport-beach-ca-newport-dunes-waterfron.editorialSummary: Casual resort offering simple beachside cottages, plus RV parking, a pool, dining & a marina.

reviewSummary.text: We have come here for years and years and have always loved it. It has always been absolutely beautiful and peaceful. The camping sites are amazing. But we always stay in the cabins and it has always been amazing. This past time however our large cabin was infested with huge roaches, the floor was held together with packing tape, and the toilet backed up so easily and ended up coming out of the sink. I did call and complain and they were very nice. But no offer of any sort of refund or any sort of help. For how much money we pay for a large cabin this was so unacceptable. I'm only writing a review in hopes that they will take The state of their cabins seriously again and do something about how much they have gone downhill.

san-diego-ca-campland-on-the-bay.editorialSummary: Beachfront 40-acre RV resort with 2 pools, a gym, games room, restaurant & half basketball court.

reviewSummary.text: Absolutely worth it and ask about discount they are super welcoming and miss Tiffany was an absolute pleasure to have us check in and give is a great location and for first time RV owners and going abound things she was absolutely helpful and kind and we paid an extra day. Thank you for being such a super welcoming person miss Tiffany! I would 100 percent recommend, clean and I felt safe and lots of families and every one kinda to themselves while others welcoming over all this place is amazing. Love security how they are very strict about letting anyone in I appreciate that

san-diego-ca-mission-bay-rv-resort.editorialSummary: Waterside RV park featuring 50-amp hookups, plus free Wi-Fi, beach access & laundry facilities.

reviewSummary.text: We walked on the public trail through this RV resort with our 15 month old. What a beautiful view! Loved it and had a nice afternoon. The only downside to this path is where the trailer homes used to be has not been updated and it's dangerous for kids -metal sticking out of the ground, bricks, holes, pokers, etc. just an fyi for anyone thinking of walking a couple miles on this trail! There are signs everywhere, but it's a shame all those people got kicked out of their homes for the land to just sit there ugly and un-landscaped at the very least!

We broke down literally across from this place on the hwy and it came as a sweet blessing. Our RV broke its suspension and we are not from CA! The staff who run this place are the kindest, down to earth, take the shirt off their back people I‚Äôve ever met in an RV park. Came around chatting us up multiple times, checking to make sure we were good. All the people in this park who live permanently were also ridiculously friendly. We‚Äôve been to 8 states and many RV parks and this hands down had a genuine, kind feeling! Safe part of town. We walked across the major hwy to Starbucks with our kids and it‚Äôs close & easy. Sad to see this RV park was bought and will close in 1 year.ü•≤ I pray all these WONDERFUL people can find new homes!

ventura-ca-ventura-beach-rv-resort.editorialSummary: Simple permanent tents, studios & trailers in a laid-back resort with an outdoor pool & a hot tub.

reviewSummary.text:
It is a beautiful RV Park and very well maintained.  Amazing concrete pads, good size and nice healthy grass at each site. We knew going in that there would be a pretty good amount of road noise and we were not wrong. What we did not know is if you happen to book on a holiday weekend (we spent 3 nights during Veterans Day weekend)or literally anytime a group books multiple sites, they pretty much have carte blanche to make as much noise as they want.  That includes playing music at concert levels until 1:00 AM and shouting F bombs at each other. We like a good time as much as anybody, but common decency and courtesy calls for taking the noise level down at say 10:00.  Not so here, we asked if there is a quiet time and were told sort of but if a group wants to party we kind of just let them.   We were two sites away from the main party location and believe me sleep was not an option, and the policies of the park are no refunds for any reason. I can say with certainty that we won't be booking here again.  Two stars for the beautiful amenities and no more for the lack of sleep. Ventura is a really great town even when you are forced into zombie mode when trying to enjoy it.
So, with all that said book at your own tolerance levels.

This is a great camping spot! There are few sites - some you can reserve in advance and some that are walk in! The bathrooms were okay. The best surprise was that they do have showers here! The sites are also super secluded and most sites have a level tent pad!

Really enjoyed our visit.  The staff was very friendly and informative about things to do in the area.  The RV park was very clean and has a great layout.  The golf course, next door, was a nice plus.  We will be returning in the future.

lake-worth-beach-fl-john-prince-park.editorialSummary: 726-acre outdoor haven with campgrounds, ball fields, playgrounds & a golf center.

reviewSummary.text: Fresh air and beautiful views and great vibes. Relaxing and a great place to exhale. Give yourself a break and just be. We all need a place to re-energize. A space to be you. Nature is amazing!

We stayed at C.B. Smith County Campground from December 8‚Äì22, 2024.

We were in Site #5, a pull-through site with full hookups, a concrete pad, a picnic table, and a grill. The site was spacious enough to comfortably fit our 42' RV, with plenty of room left to park both our truck and car in front of it.

We loved the lake view right from our site, and the area was surrounded by well-maintained grass, giving it a clean and peaceful feel.

The campground is located inside a large county park with walking paths, green space, and plenty of recreational opportunities. It‚Äôs a great place to unwind, enjoy the outdoors, and still have all the conveniences of full hookups and easy accessibility.

One of the highlights of our stay was the wildlife throughout the park. From the ducks that greeted us when we arrived, to the flocks of white ibis roaming the grounds in search of food, and the many iguanas we spotted during our stay‚Äîit felt like we were immersed in nature the entire time.

That said, a few things are worth noting: First, the campground is near a main road and hospital, so sirens were frequent, especially in the evenings. Also, on our first night, we were surprised to see someone walking through our site with a flashlight‚Äîit turned out to be a staff member checking license plates, claiming they hadn‚Äôt received our vehicle information. While harmless, it felt a little strange and unexpected. Finally, the campground can be lively at night, with people out late and loud music on several occasions.

Despite that, we enjoyed our stay and appreciated the easy access to the rest of the county park. If you‚Äôre looking for a spot that‚Äôs active and filled with nature, this is a great place to stop.

Fantastic location in St Petersburg, Florida.  The service staff is excellent and the bayou sites have all been redone.  They are recovering quite nicely from our hurricanes last year.  Great pool area and stocked market.  Really reasonable off-peak prices.  The bayou sites are nice and wide, bricked, nice outdoor furniture.  The electric hookups have been put on pedestals, great idea!  We love this place.  We live in St Pete and we just bring the camper here for the weekend sometimes.

photos.attribution: St. Petersburg / Madeira Beach KOA Holiday
St. Petersburg / Madeira Beach KOA Holiday
St. Petersburg / Madeira Beach KOA Holiday
St. Petersburg / Madeira Beach KOA Holiday
St. Petersburg / Madeira Beach KOA Holiday
St. Petersburg / Madeira Beach KOA Holiday
St. Petersburg / Madeira Beach KOA Holiday
St. Petersburg / Madeira Beach KOA Holiday

reviewSummary.text: Very nice campground, beaver lodge loop is where we we at. Nice shower/restroom combo. Hilly in areas. Walking distance to lake. Right by the cove to float or kayak. Lots of bike riding paved  trails.

Friday night we stayed at site 119 Dogwood in a pinch. Site was not flat and there was dirt covered in straw when you would step out so if it rains you‚Äôre in mud. It‚Äôs full hookup though so there‚Äôs that. From Saturday on we‚Äôve stayed at site 146 Redbud. Site is NOT full hookup although you do have water and electric. Site leans to the left and downhill at the front so it‚Äôs very hard to get leveled with a motorhome. Great shade and backs up to woods. Beach is close and there‚Äôs a bike trail that takes you right to the beach. Staff has been very friendly and helpful! Plenty of wildlife!
First time camping here, stayed in Maple leg. We really liked it very much. Everything was kept up nice. Added bonus of a very nice bike trail that connected all the legs and a few more campgrounds.

Great little off-the-highway RV park with full hook-ups. Easy access from interstate. We fit our 40ft w/15ft Cherokee connected in spot 12. Gravel, but our site was perfectly level. Didn't even bother with the leveling jacks. Water was tainted when we stayed, 11 Nov 2025 (Happy Veterans day). May be fixed by now, God knows, talk to him. Could hear some slight highway noise, but I was so tired, I didn't care about that. I slept through it, woke up next morning, cooked breakfast, pulled slides in, unplugged and rolled out.
There's a Ring doorbell at the office porch in case you roll-up late and want to check in. Convenient.
Over all a great experience for what we needed that night as we were just passing through and needed some good ol' 50-ampere action. Got really dark out at night, so we were able to get a good look at the Aurora  Borealis (see pics)
Thanks much. Ciao!

Griff's is a wonderful RV park, the best place in the DSM area to stay. The place is kept very clean, and there are lots of nice amenities like concrete pads, mail and package service, and propane filling. We stayed for about 2 months there, and the only negative I can come up with is that sometimes they would drive heavy farm equipment through the park, but it's a farm, they're just doing their jobs! There is a railroad nearby that you can hear, but it's not loud, and the park is near the Ankeny airport, so there are often planes flying overhead. Staff is super nice and helpful. The community is very calm and relaxed, there is no weekend crowd like at some campgrounds. I highly recommend Griff's, especially for long stays.

We only stayed one night and booked online, so we did not interact with staff. Not much shade as others mentioned but this is not uncommon these days.

Easy to park and we enjoyed the park. It's close to Amana Colonies - which is a very cute area with shopping, winery tasting room, brewery, bakery, coffee shop, and much more.

We loved the flat, level easy spot for our one night stay and didn't have to unhook. We would stay again for a few nights and visit Amana Colonies. We did stop at the bakery coffee shop on our way out.

Military discount when we booked online. The office was closed when we arrived but found our registration easily. They were also closed when we left (early).

fort-dodge-ia-kennedy-county-park.editorialSummary: Camping is popular at this 400-acre natural area with hiking trails & a lake for fishing & swimming.

reviewSummary.text: This park and campsite are beautiful. The playground is exceptional for kids and adults üòÜ lol. Plus the scenery is amazing and beautiful
Nice campground with great walking trails! It also has access to a small, rocky beach. Lots of good skipping rock. (Don‚Äôt drop your phone in the water) üëç

cheboygan-mi-aloha-state-park.editorialSummary: Modern camping facilities plus a boat launch, fishing, biking, swimming & paddling.

reviewSummary.text: After making dozens of trips to northern Michigan, this was our first stop at Aloha.  The park has recently been completely revamped. New playground, new paved campsite pass, electrical services, more full-hookups, and big rig friendly sites.  Best of all, it has something you can't build at a campground... Shoreline on a 17,000 acre lake, the third largest inland lake in Michigan, and breathtakingly beautiful sunsets.  And the fishing ain't bad either.  And yes there is a  place to launch your boat! We highly recommend this campground!

Beautiful campground! Shady sites with some sun, but lots of nice trees. Fairly quiet, but good spot for families. Heated pool, playground and we see a lot of kids biking around the camp. Good campground to bring your dog. They have a nice dog run. There is a camp store with a pretty large laundry room.
Just a bit pricey, but we like full hook up campgrounds, so willing to pay for it! Nice little town of Indian River. Some cute shops, ice cream, and beautiful scenery. Burt Lake State Park nearby. Swimming and boating allowed for day use if not camping there. 1/2 hour to Mackinaw City if you're in to that!....we go just for the bridge views.
Have stayed at this campground 5 times and anytime we're up this way we will continue staying here!

mackinaw-city-mi-mackinaw-mill-creek-cam.editorialSummary: Lakeside campground offering tent & RV sites, plus cabins, a heated pool, a store, games & more.

reviewSummary.text: This will be my new must stop spot on the way back home! We camped with our 21‚Äô sunraider and loved it. Our site was on the beach‚ÄîI made a fire and stayed up late enjoying the stars and sounds. (Firewood was fine! Bought a fire started from the campstore and had no issue.) The site had a level gravel parking pad which made set up a breeze. There were small ceder trees lining our site which provided privacy. The bathrooms are *very* clean and the showers are hot. The staff couldn‚Äôt be more friendly and helpful. I usually prefer rustic camping and avoid ‚ÄúRV parks‚Äù. This is a nice middle ground‚Äîlots of amenities and also lots of nature and decent privacy. The landscaping is well done and well lit. It‚Äôs family owned for multiple generations, too! We will be back.

TLDR; if you want rustic and peaceful nature, this isn‚Äôt it, and if you want nice amenities and convenience, this isn‚Äôt it either. This campground is kind of the worst of both worlds.

Super small sites. We were right on top of everyone else and had no sense of privacy or ‚Äúnature‚Äù‚Äîanother review said it feels like a parking lot, and I totally agree. Our site was completely dirt and roots, virtually no grass, and it overlooked a trash-island in the river full of scummy littered beer cans.

The fire rings do not have grates of any kind so you can‚Äôt cook over it unless you bring your own or purchase one from the camp store, and the water stations are few and far between.

The playground is old and dangerous, the bathrooms were NOT clean, and the outhouses were straight-up repulsive. The mini golf is uhhh quaint and honestly should be free to play considering that the course itself is very DIY and the putters were just a random jumble of thrift store golf clubs.

There is a handful of appropriative ‚ÄúIndian‚Äù stuff all around, but the cut-out-face photo opportunity is unabashedly racist.

My kids enjoyed the indoor pool so I guess that‚Äôs something? And all the staff I interacted with were friendly and helpful (I don‚Äôt think I encountered the infamous owner). The campground was absolutely packed but it did get quiet by 10pm.

photos.attribution: Indian Valley Campground And Canoe Livery
Indian Valley Campground And Canoe Livery

reviewSummary.text:
Nice spot to camp  for riding the Root River bike trail.

Has sewer , water, and a restroom  as well as wifi.  Park is clean and kept up  to general standards

For 30 a night I would hope they could keep the soap and toilet paper stocked.

A nice facility, we are likely to return

We just had our first camping weekend at Wildwood. We live about 15 minutes away and this is the perfect little getaway spot for us! The grounds are amazing and the staff is really friendly! We‚Äôre actually hoping to go back before they close for winter. The area is amazing. We did the Taylor‚Äôs Falls boat tour last weekend which is beautiful! Again, very friendly staff. Our son uses a wheelchair and everyone is always friendly and accommodating. We will definitely be back soon and a couple times next year.

omaha-ne-east-cunningham-campground-lake.editorialSummary: Kayaking, fishing, camping & nearby hiking trails are the draw at this urban, 390-acre reservoir.

reviewSummary.text:
We really enjoyed this park.
The camp host and workers in this park are very clean.
This park is spotless...the views of the lake and the grounds are well cared for.
Our camp host was very friendly. We reserved online and when we got here we went to our space and the camp host came to us to check us in.
What a seemless way for travelers that are tired and just want to get set up and relax.
Just FYI site 62 is beautiful lake view from the living room of RV. All sites here are cement pad and the East C section is full hook up.
If we ever get the chance to travel this way again we will definitely reserve a spot here.
Thank you for the beauty of  this state and COE for keeping these places for the people. ‚ô•Ô∏è

This review comes from the perspective of retired full-time RV‚Äôers with no young kids so take that into account when it comes to some of the criticisms.

The park is wooded and beautiful with the autumn colors. It is not incredibly big rig friendly with narrow roads, tight corners and shorter sites. While you can get bigger rigs in there it‚Äôs ideal for

buxton-or-l-l-stub-stewart-state-park.editorialSummary: Woodland park featuring rolling hills, 25 miles of hiking & horse trails, campsites & cabins.

reviewSummary.text: Great campsites. Everyone was level, spacious and generally made good use of the environment to feel private.  Wonderfull trails andd best bike path i have found so far.  The frisby golf course was a bit to wild for me due to mobility issues, but would be nice if you are extremely mobile. Full hookups in all sites I observed.  I will return.

photos.attribution: Scott Tyson, Licensed Realtor in OR & WA

reviewSummary.text: This RV park is such a gem‚Äîpeaceful, quiet, and incredibly clean throughout the entire property. There are a few lovely walking paths to enjoy, and the grassy areas are perfect for pets‚Äîour dogs had the best time rolling around and exploring. Each site even has its own patch of grass, which makes it feel extra cozy. The bathrooms and showers were spotless, and the staff couldn‚Äôt have been friendlier. The location is absolutely perfect‚Äîclose enough for errands or shopping, but when you‚Äôre back at the park it feels like a private, quiet getaway. Best of all, it‚Äôs very pet-friendly, which made our stay even better. We‚Äôll definitely be coming back again!

portland-or-columbia-river-rv-park.editorialSummary: This roomy RV park with full hookups offers laundry facilities, a recreation room & WiFi.

reviewSummary.text: We do a conference at thw Convention Center but stay here away from downtown Portland.  It's fairly quiet except for the occasional airplane overhead and maybe someone's dog. Not terribly fancy immedities but are fine during our stay. We've come back now 3 times

Perfect RV campground for traveling through after Mount Rushmore night show! Clean showers! Hot water! Dump station at our campsite. Beautiful scenery of Black Hills! Highly recommend for a stop on Western trip.

We just had our wedding here at High Country Guest Ranch on October 12th, 2025 and it was absolutely amazing!!
We 100% recommend having your wedding here or family reunion or whatever the occasion may be!!
Tina and Bob who manage the ranch and the other employees are so friendly and they went above and beyond for us!!
They saved us several times when we had stuff go wrong! They helped out wherever they could. We are so thankful that we chose to have our wedding ceremony and reception here! We stayed in the cabins and so did a lot of our family and friends! The scenery was so beautiful! Waking up and seeing the sun rising over the hills and trees! Breathtaking!
My husband and I have already decided that we will definitely be going back to stay at the cabins for many years to come!
If you want to have a gorgeous wedding, I highly recommend going here!!üíõ

Quite frankly it‚Äôs good in a pinch but honestly I‚Äôd find something better. For $60 for the PRIMITIVE The bathhouses have mold and leaks between the showers, hair on top of the drains. You‚Äôre pretty on top of your neighbors so unless you like to get friendly with strangers you‚Äôll wanna find something else. But let‚Äôs get to the real reason I‚Äôm leaving a review bc I could look over all of that if I could get a good nights sleep. But for some reason one of the longterm RVS by the office has a dog that barks. All. Night. Long. You don‚Äôt hear it during the day at all but it will wake you up and keep you up all night. Yips constantly. Honestly even in a pinch I‚Äôd just sleep in my car. This is the 2nd time we‚Äôve stayed here and it will DEFINITELY be our last. I have a video of said dog but can‚Äôt get video to load. 10/10 DO NOT RECOMMEND

Loved the deluxe cabin and proximity to Arches & Moab. General store and staff were great. We loved our stay and would stay again. A few things I want to mention. The AC unit is very loud. Bring earplugs if that would bother you. There is a lot of light coming in from outside via the window on the door. The shower head is mounted very low. I‚Äôm only 5‚Äô2‚Äù, and it was low even for me. It‚Äôs still a wonderful stay! Would definitely go back!

They are very strict with all of the rules.  This is okay but we did feel like they were watching us a lot.  Quick family trip.  The Provo airport is next store making it louder than when we stayed here a few years ago. Hosts were polite and helpful in getting us spots next to friends.  Seems to have a lot of long term guests and the whole park was quiet by 8:30 on the weekend.

Nice campground close to downtown. The neighborhood is cleaned up a lot compared to what it was when we lived in SLC several years ago. For those complaining about noise, trains, etc - you picked a park that's literally walking distance to a major metropolitan downtown. Should be common sense its not a back to nature campground. That being said, campground has nice hookups, amenities, and mature shade trees. Would stay again. Great location for those looking to enjoy what downtown SLC has to offer.

My husband and I are traveling full time in our Class C Motorhome and stayed here for about a week in September. The sites are large and well maintained with room to park a tow vehicle. The park has great amenities like a pool (although it was closed while we were there) and fitness center. There's also a walking trail in the park along the river.

I highly suggest visiting Antelope State Park if you have the chance. We saw antelope and buffalo while hiking. It's about 30-45 minutes from the park. We enjoyed our stay and would stay here again.

We had an awesome Indigenous Peoples‚Äô Weekend at Sugar Ridge with my wife and our two dogs and wow, what a spot! They‚Äôve got it all: LP tank filling, firewood, a heated pool open late into October, mini golf, and a bike trail with views that make you want to keep riding.

The staff were super friendly and always ready to help, and the showers and bathrooms were squeaky clean. We‚Äôre already planning our trip back next year and the grandkids are definitely coming with next time.

Nice, quiet campground with a variety of options - pull through with and without sewer hookups, back in sites with electric and water. The pull through sites are a bit narrow but plenty long for just about any rig.
