Excellent new park. Jeff the GM is super nice and will do everything he can to assist.  Super clean, and new.  Great ‚Äúbase camp‚Äù for exploring the area. We visited the rainforests, lavender farms, crab fest, forks, westernmost point, and the beaches. What an amazing area. You won‚Äôt be disappointed with staying here!

port-townsend-wa-fort-worden-historical-.editorialSummary: Former military base with Puget Sound shoreline, a conference center, camping & rentable houses.

reviewSummary.text:
Fort Worden State Park is a fantastic place that truly has it all. It‚Äôs a perfect spot for anyone whether you're a history buff, an outdoor enthusiast, or just looking for a great family outing with amazing wildlife.
What really stands out is the history. You don't just read about the past here; you get to walk right through it. The old forts and battle stations are incredible to explore, giving you a real, hands-on feel for what life was like back then. It's a powerful and unforgettable experience to stand in those massive concrete structures and imagine the soldiers who once manned them.
But the park isn't just about history. There's so much to do outside. You can rent a kayak to paddle the shoreline, go for a hike, or overnight camping. It‚Äôs also great place to ride a bike and explore the grounds. And at the end of the day, the sunsets are absolutely stunning the perfect way to wind down.
Plus, the park is super clean, with well-kept bathrooms, and it's just a short distance from Port Townsend. It‚Äôs the kind of place you can visit again and again and always find something new to explore.

richland-wa-wright-s-desert-gold-motel-r.editorialSummary: No-frills motel & RV park offering simple rooms with free WiFi, plus an outdoor pool & hot tub.

reviewSummary.text:
man I lived here for yeaaaars as a teenager. was a good tenant with my mom, had a daily relationship with the owners.. mom, dad, grandma and all. but when I came back after 3 years looking for a place to rent they basically mocked me and my partner. ?? ridiculous behavior when they got years of rent paid on time, peaceful neighbors, and someone who bought snacks from their concessions constantly.

literally, horrendous. why bother going through these family owned businesses if the family has no care for their most loyal and proper tenants? so yeah, horrible place. dont go here. they got problems.

No water for a while until they fix the burst pipe. 9 mins drive to dump station & fresh water fill up at the bottom of hill. Small & quiet with great views. There are plenty of spaces between each site except sites 17, 18 & 19

high-springs-fl-o-leno-state-park.editorialSummary: State park on the Santa Fe river featuring a historical suspension bridge, plus camping & hiking.

reviewSummary.text: Walked the river trail and discovered that two of the walkway bridges were closed. We had to walk down into the natural "trench" to continue on the trail.  Hopefully bridges will be repaired soon. Otherwise it's a great trail. Remember to bring bug spray and wear sturdy shoes.  There is a swimming area, but largely depends on how high the water level is.

This RV park is a gem! It's quiet & clean with well-maintained grassy areas,  30/50 amp service, and pull-through access.

Our 40' 5th wheel fit perfectly in site 18 with a beautiful view of a flowing creek running through the park. With close proximity to food, fuel, and recreation. We chose this stop so we could paddle up the Snake River to Shoshone falls, The stay was excellent‚Äîall for just $25 per night.

Highly recommend! üòÅ

bourbonnais-il-kankakee-river-state-park.editorialSummary: 4,000 acres along 11 miles of river for year-round outdoor sporting & recreation plus horse stables.

reviewSummary.text: My photos don't do it justice. The fully grown trees here are amazing especially in the fall. And the river just makes it all that much more special. There are trails here. A campground and horseback riding across the street.

6:30pm in mid September. The campground is quiet, just a little road noise, the grass is green and mowed, our site, #19 is clean and we‚Äôre watching the river from our site. I stopped in the restrooms/showers and they‚Äôre clean and fine. We have 30/50 amp electricity hook up, and water spigot at the end of our site (see photo). A water refill and dump station could be seen as we drive in as well as a dumpster for bagged trash. Everything is lovely, just wish we had more than an overnight here.
We paid only $13 due to having a Senior Lifetime pass, otherwise it would‚Äôve been $26.
This is a well-kept park.   It is close to the water, so you will see ducks in that area. This was in the afternoon that we visited, and there were a lot of people enjoying this park.

We went to the park while traveling for baseball. My two youngest children absolutely loved it. There were a lot of different unique parts of the park, that we had never seen anywhere else before. It's even big enough for adults to climb on and still have room to move. We would definitely recommend checking it out!

woodward-ia-whistlin-donkey.editorialSummary: Unfussy option offering wings, wraps & other basics, plus many flat-screen TVs in a simple setting.

reviewSummary.text: We love the small town friendly atmosphere. The patio is awesome especially when the outside bar is open. The food is satisfying and the service is great too. It's right on the trail.

baton-rouge-la-farr-park-equestrian-cent.editorialSummary: Horse boarding facility featuring indoor & outdoor arenas, trail rides, lessons & an RV campground.

reviewSummary.text: My daughter and I had a fabulous time riding at Farr Park this morning. The horses appeared very well cared for. The staff were very friendly and knowledgeable about the horses and their individual personalities. The trail ride was beautiful! We've also been for a horse show. The facility is great.
We had a great stay at the Alpena fairgrounds. Beautiful sunsets. Great five mile bike ride around the lake. Quiet!

bay-city-mi-bay-city-state-park.editorialSummary: This destination for a range of activities, including biking, fishing & hiking, also has campsites.

reviewSummary.text: We were visiting family and they brought us here for the day. It is absolutely beautiful here. Nice and clean. There is tons of parking and places to picnic. Whether you want to play at the beach or take the kids to the splash pad, there is something for  everyone.

ludington-mi-ludingtonstate-park.editorialSummary: Park bookended by 2 lakes offers modern & remote campsites, sandy beaches & year-round activities.

reviewSummary.text: This is by far my favorite State Park to stay at! Is it hard to get reservations? Yes. Is it worth it? Absolutely! There is so much to do, you'll never be bored. Spend your days walking the miles of beautiful trails; kayak Lost Lake or Lake Michigan; float down or fish the Big Sable river; take a walk to the lighthouse; spend the day at the beach; take in the wildlife while on a bike ride; end you're days with some ice cream from the camp store.

We took advantage of the Choo-choo kayak adventure.  Will, our charming kayak carter, escorted us to the train.  The train stopped for us, and then took us up the river.  At the northern stop Will was there to meet us with the kayaks and we made our way down river back to the Marina.  The staff at the Marina are very helpful.  I highly recommend this way to see the St. Louis River and a bit of Duluth you don‚Äôt normally visit.  It was a great way to spend a few hours.

hinckley-mn-st-croix-state-park.editorialSummary: 34,000-acre park with 2 rivers, a lake & miles of trails for hiking, cycling & horseback riding.

reviewSummary.text:
This is a really big Park! So many different places to go and see.
I missed the fire tower was running late and went to two rivers.
What a view down there. Little confusing to get to.
But once you get down the Dead end road there's lots of signs and places to go.
Definitely going to go back and explore other areas there.
Very clean and well thought out.
On the two Rivers walk there was lots of benches along the river.
You could definitely spend a whole day at St Croix State Park exploring!
I will definitely be going back.

park-hills-mo-st-joe-state-park.editorialSummary: This park permits vehicles such as motorcycles & snow mobiles, plus offers lake swimming & trails.

reviewSummary.text:
This was a much larger Park than I expected. I also had no idea that it was a very popular place for off-road vehicles. We selected the campground closer to the off-road vehicle area which includes 54 mi of off-road trails.

The campground was large and spacious. I had one of the cleanest bathrooms I think I've seen in a Missouri State Park. Even the 2 vault toilets next to our campsite were kept clean.

While you could hear sometimes the dirt bikes or four-wheelers off in the distance from the campground and people would drive around the campground on them. They were respectful of the area and didn't go speeding through. And everybody was respectful of quiet hours, not revving up their engines all night.

The campground locked at night and you needed a code to get in and out at night. Probably to deter thieves

I did not get to check out the Horace centric campground because it was gated shuts and I think you needed a code to get in and out.

Wow! Best Park Ever!!  I have been to many campgrounds in my travels but this one is by far the Cleanest, coolest campground ever!!! Plenty of space. Not crowded. The walking trails around the park are super maintained. There is the most perfect exercise station set up in the park! So awesome! I would highly recommend this park to everyone who loves the outdoors. Very pet friendly and child friendly. Lots of playground space/items for your kiddos to play. Great atmosphere!
Love, love, love, this park! Will stay again if I pass thru. But next time I will stay longer !!!
I give them a 100% Top Notch all the way around.

It was quiet and pretty campground fairly well  maintained.  The vault bathroom did not have hand sanitizer or any other way to clean your hands. Or picnic table was also in bad shape with termites that had been there for a while. Lots of shade trees. Fire pits were nice. They gave you a map on entrance. I felt as if the price was a little high. 14$ park pass and 25$ electric camp site.

Cain Hollow is one of my favorite places to camp. The electrical hookup next to the tent is so convenient, the bathrooms are close no matter which plot you camp in. Allegany is an amazing place, I highly recommend it to everyone. It's one of my favorite places to be.

This park is so amazing.
You feel better when you go hiking, fishing, camping, just taking a ride through the park. All season's are beautiful.  It's great for all ages.üçÄüåû The hiking trails are very easy to follow. I personally love that.

I camped out every nite for 7 days I was completely comfortable park security made me feel very safe. It was very close to stores and gas stations there's a Beautiful Lake in the center of campgrounds with ‚õµ ramp. I give it 5 thumbs up. I will be back.

cascade-locks-or-viento-state-park-mt-ho.editorialSummary: Picturesque park draws visitors with its access to windsurfing, scenic hikes, & a modern campsite.

reviewSummary.text: This park is in the worst location possible. It‚Äôs sandwiched between an interstate and a very active railroad. Not only a railroad but also a railroad crossing so you hear the very loud train blow the horn 3-4 times when it passes by. How many times does it pass by you ask? Multiple times an hour and that‚Äôs 24/7. My rv was backed up to the interstate so between the heavy traffic, tractor trailers, motorcycles, etc. and the train, I didn‚Äôt sleep the 3 nights I was there. I sleep with a box fan next to my head but it was no match for this noise level. I felt bad for the people in tents. Also, there‚Äôs no tent area so tons of tents next to rv‚Äôs which is annoying due to noise. But hey, the train and traffic will pretty much drown out people noise anyway at this campground. The website states certain sites will hear the trains more. Rest assured EVERY site hears it loud and clear. The north loop is just a small circle and there are no quiet sites. Sure, there‚Äôs a lake and people seem to go for kite surfing. Get a day pass and do that if that‚Äôs your thing. I‚Äôd never recommend anyone to actually camp here.

edisto-island-sc-edisto-beach-state-park.editorialSummary: Serene park with beach access offers trails for hiking & biking plus campsites & furnished cabins.

reviewSummary.text:
Edisto Beach State park is an amazing place. Just look at those pictures, and that is just a glimpse.

We stayed in camp site 3 as we have in the past. It is not flat, the ground goes up and then back down, but for a tent camp site it is ideal.

The camp hosts that are caring for the site right now are a step above. I've never been at a SC state camp ground that had dirty bathrooms etc.  The level up that this team's was amazing they had bug deterant bags through out the camp grounds. Bathrooms were impeccably clean.  Even had a night where a couple of campers were not the cleanest in the showers, with sand and other thing all over the showers.  By the next morning they were fully cleaned with no evidence of their mess and 0 complaint from the hosts! I was shocked üò≤ at how cleaning was.  Many many thanks to the amazing staff at the Park.

I love this place, I've been there many times and never got tired of it, the restrooms are clean, the showers too, everything is clean and nice, there's also a laundry room.
There are cabins to stay, there's also space for RVs and tents, the little creek is so beautiful.  The wild loop is right there and you can drive around and watch the animals, I really love this place

Grace Coolidge campground is a great little campground that is clean, well kept, and quiet.  We had a back-in site which was perfect for our 25 ft travel trailer and pickup and it had 50 amp electric only (no water/sewer) although there is a dump station about 2 miles down the road.  The "pull-out" spots are pretty small and really only appropriate for a tent or small camper van. The bathrooms were very clean and updated and the showers are great.  The camp host here (we didn't remember her name) is such a sweetheart and will help you with anything you need.  We would definitely recommend this campground to anyone who desires a smaller, quiet campground.

yankton-sd-chief-white-crane-recreation-.editorialSummary: Natural recreation area with wildlife-watching opportunities, cabins, camping & boating on the lake.

reviewSummary.text: Large campground.  One of many public campgrounds in the area. Stayed for a week after election day. One of 4 sites occupied. With the lack of campers in mind the restrooms/shower houses were very clean. Sites generally have plenty of room between.  Most are plenty level. Several are directly on the lake. Comfort station was very clean and easy access. Nice trails that actually go into Yankton. Great for a bike ride. Can't say enough good about South Dakota Recreation areas.
People, stop throwing trash in the park! Take care of the area you get to enjoy with your family and friends. It's common sense.

yankton-sd-lewis-clark-recreation-area.editorialSummary: Lakeside campgrounds & sandy beaches, multi-use trails, plus a resort, restaurant & boat marina.

reviewSummary.text: Very clean bathrooms and located on the Missouri River. I rented a cabin for $60/night that had access to a beach area on the river. It was quiet in early October and a great value as we were there for paddlefishing. The cabin had electrical outlets, AC and heat but we needed to just bring bedding and pillows. It was pretty hassle free.

yankton-sd-pierson-ranch-recreation-area.editorialSummary: Well-equipped campsite with a park area, picnic shelters, ball courts & a playground.

reviewSummary.text: A State Camp on the north end of lake Yankton. It's below the dam so a little more protected from winds. Bike path from town runs thru to camp ground above dam. Large picnic area used for large events. New playgrounds. Easy access to Lake Yankton. Kayaks and canoes, no motors.

We camp a lot at State and federal campgrounds because we prefer the larger wooded sites and don‚Äôt care about bingo or the 4PM hay ride.  This is one of the best values we‚Äôve found because the sites are plentiful, good sized, spaced apart and all come with 20 and 30A electric.  Don‚Äôt worry if you‚Äôre over the official 26‚Äô length limit as nearly all sites would accommodate a 30+ foot RV.  The lake has a nice 3 mile trail around it and a beach for swimming.  The camp store is well provisioned and everyone we met as far as staff were very kind and helpful.  For $20 fee was very fair compared to twice that for sites in our home state of NH at Dolly Copp in the White Mountain National Forest.  Super value.

georgetown-tx-cedar-breaks-park.editorialSummary: Scenic park offering 64 fully equipped camping sites, plus a dump station & hot showers.

reviewSummary.text: What a great place for a day picnic, overnight camping, hiking, biking, fishing, and any type of water activities i.e. swimming, SUP, kayaking, jet skis, boating, wake boarding you name it!  Its only a $5.00 day entrance fee per car load!  Exceptionally clean clear blue green water no moss or any type of top water vegetation!  Amazing views with nice picnic areas  Was not crowded at all!  What a hidden gem just 30 mins north of Austin!  Highly recommended and I am a new forever patron!

Seven Mile RV Park was a perfect location for us to visit Moab, Canyonlands, and Arches. The sites are huge, private and they have a beautiful view of mountains and stars at night! The staff was very friendly and very helpful! We made great memories here. Thank you for helping make our family vacation an adventure!
Beautiful but run down and stinky. Cool playground. No trail access.

A quiet campground with some sites overlooking the water and others under the partial shade of the maple trees.   The sites in the middle are very close together and mixed amongst session or permanent sites.

No issues with the hook ups and they recommend you have a regulator due to the high water pressure.  There is a laundry room which we used.  There were washers ($2.00) and 3 dryers ($0.25 for 5 minutes).

There is a nice path for biking and walking.  You can use it to walk downtown (not much there) or to a border crossing.

The campground is clean.  The staff, especially the lady in the office, are awesome.

A hidden gem to drive or walk to is T Bar and Hoagies Pizza and Pasta.  They‚Äôre connected.  The food and drinks were good and reasonable.  Next door is Village Market grocery store with had liquor store as well.

nine-mile-falls-wa-riverside-state-park.editorialSummary: 14,000 acres of woodlands along the Spokane River offering campsites, trails & an off-roading area.

reviewSummary.text:
We attended an AERC endurance ride and camped with horses at the airstrip. The trail system here is quite remarkable. Many multi use trails with a variety of views and technicalities. We really enjoyed our ride (30 miles) and are already considering visiting again on our own.
There was a new shelter with picnic tables. Bring your own shade and water in the summer. The weekend we were there,  the water was turned off.

cairo-wv-north-bend-state-park.editorialSummary: Woodsy, laid-back property set amid forest in North Bend State Park, plus a restaurant with views.

reviewSummary.text: We've visited many parks. I think this one is quite good. We stayed in one of the 3 bedroom cabins #2. It's been remodeled, plenty of room, gas fireplace, huge kitchen and living room, big table. There was even coffee with filters there, although no salt or pepper so bring your own. Furnace kept the place warm, it was clean and no mice- we had experienced them in other cabins before...We were a little disappointed that it didn't have wood burning fireplace or outdoor pit, but everything else made up for it. The master bedroom has king bed and second bath. There are hiking trails quite close to the cabins. The different trails all over the park are at many difficulty levels. Mini gulf at the lodge is really needing repairs but we still had fun and used the imperfections as traps. üòÜ We will be back.

One of two things could make this CG perfect.   Either lower nightly rates, or adding water to the campsite.  While $50-ish per night isn't too bad - not having water/sewer hookups make it pricy.   Wifi is only available at the bathhouse - which is a great thing if you are looking to disconnect as there is zero cell service.  It is a short distance to the Greenbrier River Trail.  Overall the facility and campsite was very well maintained.

This is a quiet and well maintained little campground close to downtown.   Most sites have electric only but there are clean bathrooms and showers available.   It's a 7 minute drive to downtown Madison and the university.  The biking and hiking trail system is amazing as well.

townsend-tn-cades-cove.editorialSummary: Valley in Great Smokey Mountains National Park with a loop route, wildlife & preserved homesteads.

reviewSummary.text:
For obvious reasons, this should be 5 stars, but humans really have to ruin it every time.
But first with the good stuff. We got SO incredibly lucky and saw 7 bears!!! We arrived at the front of the park at about 805 am. The fog was pretty thick for the first 20 min or so of the drive, but it was amazing watch it become clearer as we drove through. We saw so many deer and about 10 were playing in field that we watched for probably 15 minutes.

Now. I absolutely expect that traffic is going to be slow. I get it if someone doesn't pull over and stops for 5-10 seconds to take a picture or quick video of something even though there are signs literally everywhere that say "don't idle". But when we saw the first group of 4 bears, we were stopped for almost 30 minutes. I guarantee you that probably hundreds more people would have able to also seen them if people in front of us had common decency. Like I get it, it's an amazing sight, but seriously the people who selfishly stop for 3 or 4 minutes when they could pull over ahead and walk back is ridiculous. It's literally just about being respectful and decent.

So anyway, rant over, it was one of the most amazing experiences I've ever had and I absolutely recommend going early. I think we went at the perfect time to see what we saw.

moab-ut-goose-island-campground.editorialSummary: Campground with basic facilities, including fire grates & vault toilets, plus striking canyon views.

reviewSummary.text: Such a beautiful campground! Great location right on the river and close to town without feeling like it. The pit toilets were clean and stocked. The shade structure was very nice. Group site B was a little spendy but spread out over a large group it was actually very reasonable. Highly recommend if you're bringing a number of families together!

lincoln-city-in-lincoln-state-park.editorialSummary: Memorial honoring President Lincoln & his family offers boating, camping, swimming & hiking.

reviewSummary.text: We spent three nights here camping and exploring.  The campground was well kept and the restroom/shower facilities were clean and more than adequate.  Mid week was not too crowded but by the weekend most sites were occupied. Rangers patrolled quite often and were always helpful. The lake was beautiful with numerous places to sit and enjoy or to fish if desired.  We were disappointed that they did not have the boat rentals available during our stay for some reason. There are several nice hiking trails to enjoy as well. The park has a nice beach area and a camp store. The Lincoln Bicentennial Plaza was very impressive as was the Lincoln Boyhood Home National Memorial that is located just across the road from the entrance to the state park. Camping costs were moderate and we felt it was a good value for the stay.
20 miles of a straight line of unpaved dirt roads with lots of potholes leads into a beautiful campsite with lots of trails to explore.

This RV park is a great place to stay , clean level sites with FHU , both 50 and 30 amp service, plenty of room to park my unit. Really nice owner‚Äôs who are actively involved with the park and very helpful. The park it self is in a quite rural sitting , there is a bike trail at the entrance of the park that you can ride on , that goes in to town and also to other local attractions. We took the trail to a place called the Farm Stand and had lunch , best Tacos! I will stay here again.

Really enjoyed our stay.(winter 24/25) Great RV park, fantastic onsite manager and owners.
Nice large, clean, well-maintained sites. Bathhouse is adequate, secure and always very clean.
Almost constant lite breeze off of lake and harbor. Very few insects.
Direct trail access. Lots of local shops, restaurants, and grocery stores.
Owners and staff working everyday to keep park clean and well maintained.
Manager also help us with a small RV issue, and double checked to make sure we were all good.
Highly recommend and would definitely stay again when in the area.

Buddy Camping set up with pull thru sites was very nice (no shade though - thankful we had our awnings from both campers to shade our shared concrete slab/picnic bench. Nice walking trail to the beautiful pond. The National Infantry Museum is a must! I also recommend Moe's BBQ Restaurant.

By some random streak of luck (as of 11/4/2025), Mather Campground is WIDE OPEN. Normally you need to book 6 months in advance but due to the government shutdown (sorry park rangers) the ground was closed and then reopened. We went 10/31-11/2 and the bathrooms were stocked, water was still running, and there was no park entrance fee. These are flushable bathrooms with lights, sinks, and soap. Big trash dumpsters are nearby for safely throwing away trash. This campground is also right next to the south rim trail! We stayed at 170, a short walk to the bathrooms but still private and beautiful. I recommended doing the Trail of Time for an easy walk around the rim. It‚Äôll be very cold at night (around 30 degrees) but warm in the sun during the day. Grandview Point is fabulous for sunrise + sunset views. You can go to mather point at night for some awesome stargazing!

tucson-az-south-forty-rv-ranch.editorialSummary: Pets are welcome at this adults-only RV park offering a clubhouse with a gym, heated pool & spa.

reviewSummary.text: We stayed here for 10 days and overall it was a nice and clean shower, bathroom, laundry $$$ and pool area. The office staff were polite but not efficient in accounting. They blamed their mistakes on the computer not functioning. We got a veteran discount but the extra taxes were similar to hotel taxes. We stayed at many rv resorts across U.S. and never charged extra taxes similar to hotel taxes. We had our own rv and just rented a site space! Also, my dog didn‚Äôt want to go to their little dog park, there was hardly no shade, trees or grass and it smelled badly. It could have been managed better. When I return to Tucson, I will find another rv resort and will not be paying high taxes.
